Experience the most advanced and accurate flight models available on the PC, each validated by the experts--Cessna, Learjet, and aerobatic champion Patty Wagstaff.
Ready for a hop in a chopper? Try the new Bell 206B JetRanger III helicopter.
Blast off in the brand-new Learjet 45, a plane even the jet-setters are still waiting to fly.
Fly your favorites--the Cessna 182 Skylane, Extra 300S, Boeing 737-400, Schweizer sailplane, and Sopwith Camel.


Climb into the pilot's seat. Take the controls.


3-D acceleration and MMX technology snap scenery into an electrifying new dimension.
High-resolution instrument panels put you in today's technologically advanced cockpits.
Digitally sampled sounds bring each aircraft roaring to life.


Flight Simulator 98 gives you more of the globe than ever before.


Take off from more than 3,000 airports worldwide. With 10 times more airports than before, you'll be in the traffic pattern at airline hubs and suburban airstrips.
Detailed scenery for 45 international metropolitan areas, including 20 new U.S. cities, lets you start your adventures almost anywhere--even from a skyscraper helipad!


Experience crowded skies and G-force feedback.


Multiplayer features put you in the sky with other pilots via Internet or network connections.
Free Internet matchmaking on the Internet Gaming Zone lets you enter international airshows and aerobatic competitions.
Force-feedback joystick support makes "pulling G's" more than just a game.

139707.name: Don't Drink the Water
139707.description:
From publisher blurb:

Howdy Marshal! It’s time for a little fun south o’ the Border. We’re going to take your posse on a quick jaunt into ol’ Mexico where they get to dodge the Foreign Legion, aid some revolutionaries, and put a few wayward dead folks back into Boot Hill where they belong! So saddle up and throw on your poncho, but don’t drink the water! Don't Drink the Water is rough-ridin' Savage Tale for the award-winning Deadlands RPG.

139708.name: Widget
139708.description:
Widget is a fast, easy-to-play, card game that asks players to make crazy, silly, funny, weird, unusual or otherwise great sentences out of the words they have in their hands.

The person who creates the "best" sentence, as judged by the other players, wins. Special cards that allow players to switch cards around along with other special rules add an element of strategy to the game, making it easy to learn but different and exciting every time you play.

The words and the illustrations have been carefully selected such that it makes Widget a family-friendly game that also works as a good party game for adults.

139710.name: San Guo Sha: SP Characters 2012
boardgameexpansion: Legends of the Three Kingdoms
San Guo Sha: Fire
San Guo Sha: Overnight Fame 2012
139710.description: This expansion is a collector's edition. It adds 9 new character cards to the game. 7 of these characters were already present in the base version of the game but have gotten new artwork and new abilities. These new character cards does not replace the old ones, since the abilities are different. 2 new characters are also introduced. The cards were released monthly in some issues of Zhuo You Zhi magazine as a free gift.

139711.name: The Mind's Lie
139711.description:
The Mind’s Lie is a game about how our minds consistently look at situations in biased and misleading ways. The goal in this game is to spot these errors and convince the other players that you are correct.

The Mind’s Lie is normally a game for 3-6 players that can be played in 30 minutes or less. Players take turns reading scenarios and then attempt to identify the biases inherent in each situation. Players then vote in secret and, after the reveal, try to convince each other to change their positions. The player who is most successful at convincing other players to vote as the player votes wins the game.

Over time, it is expected that players will gain the ability to identify and mitigate the effects of common cognitive biases in everyday life, thereby improving their critical thinking and decision making skills.

139712.name: Far from Home
139712.description:
Far from Home is a SCIFI board game where two space crews vie for survival. Only the destruction of the enemy capital ship will ensure the future of your crew. Out thinking your enemy and the successful allocation of your resources are your only means of success. The timely deployment and upgrading of your ships may provide a necessary advantage but watch out, your enemy will do whatever it takes to survive. You do have an ace up your sleeve, the powerful Capital Laser. But its success is dependent on a roll of the die and your opponent’s resolve to shield it. Do you have what it takes to survive far from home?

Far from Home is a Print and Play SCIFI wargame for an audience looking to scratch the SCIFI wargame itch in under an hour.
The game itself prints on two 8 1/2 x 11 sheets of paper: 1 sheet with Map and the other sheet with ships-double sided, required tokens, and a tech tree.

Pennies are used for action points.

The rule book is 5 pages long.

139713.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator for Windows 95
139713.description:
Back of Box

The world leader in flight simulation takes you to new levels of realism, adventure and challenge. You've never flown like this before!

Ultra-realistic planes provide an unparalleled flight experience!


Two new planes--the Boeing 737-400 and the aerobatic Extra 300S join the Cessna 182 RG, Learjet 35A, Schweitzer 2-32, and Sopwith Camel.
Digitized instrument panels are featured for all six planes.


See the world in spectacular detail!


More 3-D detailed cities--San Francisco, London, Tokyo, New York, Paris, Chicago, Seattle, and many more.
New! Photo-realistic satellite imaging--stunning scenery of Martha's Vineyard, Chelan, and Las Vegas.
World of Scenery--fly to more than 300 airports and view world-famous landmarks, like Big Ben or the Taj Mahal.


Start flying in seconds!


New! Virtual Pilot Instruction guides you through every step of your flight.
New! Multimedia Flight School instructs you in basic-to-complex maneuvers.
New! AutoInstall and AutoPlay get you out on the runway fast.
Select your plane, airport, weather, and time of day - and take off!


Take off for adventure!


Push your flight skills to the limit with new challenges.
Complete point-to-point missions on exciting adventures.

139714.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2002
videogamehonor: 2002 D.I.C.E. Best Visual Engineering of the Year Nominee
2002 D.I.C.E. Simulation Game of the Year Winner
139714.description:
Microsoft Flight Simulator 2002 (FS2002) was version 8.0 of Flight Simulator. It offered vast improvements over previous versions.

In addition to improved graphics, FS2002 introduced air traffic control (ATC) and artificial intelligence (AI) aircraft enabling users to fly alongside computer controlled aircraft and communicate with airports. An option for a target framerate was added, enabling a cap on the framerate to reduce stutter while performing texture loading and other maintenance tasks. In addition, the FS2002 aircraft feature 3D virtual cockpits. The external view featured an inertia effect, inducing an illusion of movement in a realistic physical environment.

Anticipation was high for this version because of its interactive AI traffic and ATC features. Due to the September 11 attacks, release of the software was postponed to remove the twin towers of the World Trade Center in all copies.

A free copy of Fighter Ace II was also included with the software.

Source: Wikipedia, "Flight Simulator 98", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139715.name: Fantasy Ancients
139715.description:
Rules for games using miniatures. The author is identified only as O'Neil. There are 32 pages of rules with a card stock insert of charts and tables.

The rules cover the gray area of gaming between fantasy role playing games and the large tactical Ancients army game. Players can use the rules to recreate gladitorial combat between man vs. man (or man vs. fantasy race) combat or they can use them to recreate massive battles such the Trojan Wars or the battles in Middle Earth.

The Game Sequence:
1. Charges and spells are declared.
2. Counter charges and counter spells.
3. Reaction tests to charges and spells.
4. Normal movement.
5. Missile fire (ranged combat).
6. Reaction tests to missile fire.
7. Melee (hand to hand) combat.
8. Reation tests to melee combat.
Steps 1-8 are repeated until one side is victorious.

139716.name: Monster Kart Mayhem (RPGG Contest Entry)
rpgpodcastepisode: Special Episode: Interview With Jacob Wood
139716.description:
Excerpt from Monster Kart Mayhem:

Each year, thousands of monsters gather in Transylvania to witness the Monster Mash, a speed race and battle royal of monstrous proportions. Contestants race across 1,000 kilometers of the country’s harshest terrain and attempt to reach the finish line even as their opponents try to blast them off the road. This year marks the 50th anniversary of the Monster Mash. Who will cross the finish line first? Who will even cross at all?

Monster Kart Mayhem is a racing adventure for two or more monsters (the more the gruesomer). There are no Game Monsters to dictate the outcome; just you and your fellow ghoulish compatriots and a few dice to decide your fate.


in 2014 this adventure was expanded into it's own RPG Monster Kart Mayhem

139717.name: Exploding Earth Extravaganza
139717.description:
Excerpt from Exploding Earth Extravaganza:

Dr. Upto Nogood has devised something dire! Deep under the sea, he is drilling a hole into the Earth’s crust. He intends to drain the ocean, plug the hole, and wait for the immense build-up of steam to cause an explosion that will obliterate the planet!
It is up to our intrepid heroes to stop him, but will they be able to battle their way past laser-shooting sharks and twisted octo-bots with enough time left over to put an end to his evil ways?

139719.name: Eagle One
139719.description:
A system of rules for modern aerial combat using aircraft miniatures or using paper & pencil on large sheets of paper (alternately, grease pencils on clear plastic sheets).

There are 20+ pages of rules and 4 different 2-sided data charts (2 copies of each).

Aircraft information for modern era (pre-1980) aircraft provides performance (speeds, maneuvering) and armament data (number of guns, range, damage). Players recreate historical or hypothetical aerial battles using NATO, Warsaw Pact or other air forces.

Shorter scenarios use primarily 1-2 aircraft per player.

Larger numbers of players would allow different types of aircraft, such as bombers and escorts being attacked by defense fighters. These smallest of these actions (scenarios) can last 120+ turns and involve an area of 200" x 300" (19.7 ft x 25 ft.).

1 Turn=10 seconds
1 Unit=2 miles

For miniatures play, the editor recommends a large floor area with 1 unit=10 cm (or 4-5 inches).

139720.name: Leopard Tracks
139720.description:
These rules are for use with Modern micro armor miniatures in 1/285th and 1/300th scale. The rules are suitable for use with HO scale models if adjustments are made to the sizes of the artillery and bomb grids.

Ground scale is 1"=50 yds (1:1800) and each turn represents about 1 minute. 6, 12 and 20 sided dice, rulers and playing pieces are required for play. Sighting distances in unobstructed areas range from 40" to 80", so the playing area should take this into account. Players provide their own terrain as required by their scenario instuctions.

The rules concisely cover movement, sighting, vehicles, infantry, artillery, chemical weapons, smoke, minefields, aircraft, helicopters and antiaircraft artillery.

Using the information in the military organization section, players can deploy a military force based on a country's actual military practices.

139721.name: The Wycliffe Game
139721.description:
This game was created by the Wycliffe Bible Translators, an organization with the goal of translating the Bible into every language on earth, to give potential recruits an idea of the hazards, obstacles and rewards of working for Wycliffe.

Though there is no publication date, the game appears to be from the 1970s or '80s. It is primarily a roll-and-move game in which players must start on an inner (or Home Country) track and amass items, knowledge, funds and supporters that will allow them to proceed to an outer (or Tribal Work) track, where they must overcome various trials and be the first to finish their translation. While the mechanic seems to be mainly roll-and-move, there are a few decisions that may add a small element of strategy.

From the game box: "Taste the problems & joys of a Bible Translator--without getting your feet muddy. First, getting training and support at home. Then language work and pioneering abroad. Real-life incidents to help or hinder. The first to complete St. Mark's Gospel wins the game."

139722.name: JapanScenery Vol. 1 Tokyo Photorealistic Scenery
videogameexpansion: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004: A Century of Flight
139722.description:
JapanScenery Vol.1 Tokyo Photorealistic Scenery brings out the full potential of Today's Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004 / 2002.
Covers Vast Kanto Plain
It is the first photoreal scenery that covers the vast Kanto Plain region, where is around the metropolitan Tokyo, and Izu & Ogasawara Islands with full resolution. The crisp scenery created from almost 18,000 aerial photographs by special courtesy of NTT-ME Corporation, Geographical Survey Institute of Japan and National Land and Transportation Ministry of Japan.

The Kanto Plain spreads from Tokyo-Chiba-Yokohama Bay area to Miura Peninsula Kanagawa, where Yokosuka is located, Kamakura, Shonan Coast, Atsugi, Sagamihara, Tama, Saitama, Southern part of Gunma, Tsukuba and Narita. The full resolution photoreal scenery also covers Izu and Ogasawara Islands.
[Airports in Area Covered]
Haneda Tokyo INTL, Narita New Tokyo INTL, Yokota AFB, Atsugi, Tachikawa, Iruma, Shimofusa, Kisarazu, Chofu, Ootone, Oonishi, Honda, Tokyo Heliport, Ooshima, Miyakejima, Hachijyojima, Nijima, Iwo-jima


Ultraprecise Tokyo International Airport



3D Cityscapes



Full Seasonal & Night Textures



2.7GB 60000 files of data


Entire Japan Mesh Bundled

Japan Terrain Mesh Scenery (JTMS) is bundled. JTMS is DEM (degital elevation data) of 152m, 76m and 38m LOD (level of details) that covers entire Japan. You'd better to use 3 different LODs simultaneously to optimize near and distant landscape. Again bundled terrain mesh data is for all of Japan.

Source: Archived Publisher Website.

139723.name: JapanScenery Vol. 2 Kansai Photorealistic Scenery
videogameexpansion: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004: A Century of Flight
139723.description:
Full photoreal coverage of Kansai region

The center of western Japan: the Kansai region constellates the most exciting traveling spots: Osaka, Kyoto, Nara, Kobe, Himeji and so on. The Kansai is the heart of dramatic Japanese millenniums. The historic Kyoto had been not only the imperial capital but also the locus of our unique Buddhist culture. As you can feel, Kyoto's temples like Kiyomizu reflect serenity of its landscape directly.
Surrounded by silent and even gentle mountains the people had meditated very deeply and its tradition has not changed. This natural scape has such a big healing power and you will surely experience the miracle.
Vol.2 Kansai will never interrupt your dreamy flights with almost triple time broader coverage of smooth photorealistic scenery than our Vol.1. The rich coverage spreads the variety from the core cityscape of Osaka-Kobe bay area, the historic town scape of Kyoto-Nara district, to mountainous whole neighboring regions of Kansai: Western Japan whitherward sunrising Pacific and Sea of Japan.

So, this first vast volume marks the beginning of our series' potential expansion to whole Japanese realm coverage for Microsoft Flight Simulator.

Covered Areas

Osaka, Kyoto, Nara, Kobe, Akashi, Kakogawa, Himeji, Awaji, Wakayama, Kii peninsula, Ise, Matsuzaka, Biwa Lake, Otsu, Hikone, Wakasa bay, Toyooka....

Source: Archived Publisher Website.

139724.description: With this Bolt Action supplement players can now build armies for British and Commonwealth troops such as the Australians, New Zealanders, Canadians, Polish Airborne, and Gurkha's. From the early campaigns in Europe to the deserts of North Africa, and the jungles of the South Pacific and the Far East, British Commonwealth forces faced the Axis threat.
139724.name: Bolt Action: Armies of Great Britain
boardgameexpansion: Bolt Action

139725.description:
Educational game for kids to learn the clock, based on the popular Maya the bee theme.

Each player plays Maya the bee who wants to visit her friend Willy (a picture in the center of the spiral board). The board is also a large clock, with fingers starting at 10 o'clock.
Players start on the outside of the board, moving in a spiral towards the middle, using a simple roll and move system. There are fields in different colors, some having special effects:
On a Philip field, players receive a protective card that they might need when someone gets on a clock field. On a clock field, players draw a clock card and have to set the new time. The clock fingers push the Maya pieces back on the spiral, unless countered by a Philip card.

The first player to reach Willy is the winner.
139725.name: Maja: Tick Tack Tempo

139726.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2002: Professional Edition
139726.description:
User Summary

This enhanced edition of Flight Simulator 2002 includes the following additional features, as described on the back of the box and publisher website.

Back of Box

Flight Instructor

Failed instruments, gusty winds, an engine failure. An "instructor" can monitor your progress--and test your skills--from anywhere in the world via the internet.

Creative Tools

Microsoft teamed up with Discreet to offer gmax, a 3D modeling tool that makes it easy to create aircraft, buildings, and other 3D objects that you can add to your flight experience.

New Aircraft

Rayethon BE58 Baron
Cessna 208 Grand Caravan
Raytheon/Beech King Air 350
Mooney Bravo

Publisher Website

Flight Analysis and Instructor's Station: Pilots working to improve their skills and enthusiasts looking for new challenges and bragging rights can check the precision of their flying. Maps and graphs show how well you maintained course and altitude. FS2002 Professional Edition also includes a multiplayer "instructor's station" for pilots who want to take on anything that a wily instructor can throw at them.

Source: Archived Publisher Website.

139727.name: Red Jets
139727.description:
Back of Box

Introduction

'Red Jets' pulls you back in time to a day and place where the Cold War defined right and wrong... You find yourself in the cockpit of the notorious Soviet MiG fighter and watch history take a spin as it opens the door to an alternative line of events, and the Cold War heats up!

'Red Jets' is a 3D combat jet plane game inspired by the Cold War conflict and a USSR Air Force in its prime. The line of events may be pure fiction but the environment and the atmosphere is as authentic as can be, and as you dive into a world of military discipline, honor, the lines of right and wrong begin to blur...

Red Jets is built on InterActive Vision's powerful jet fighter engine and features advanced weather simulation, detailed landscapes based on real-life satellite imagery, super realistic aircraft and weapons, and intense dogfight scenarios.

Features


Realistic flight physics
Detailed cockpit and external views
Classic jet fighters such as the MiG-29 Fulcrum, Yak-141 Freestyle, and Su-27 Flanker
Advanced weapons and targeting system
20 Missions, 30 Scenarios
Realistic landscapes rendered from actual satellite maps
Realistic visual weather system to simulate flight in all kinds of weather and times of day
Up to 16 Multiplayer mode!
Create your own missions!

139728.description:
MCS pits 2 or 4 players against each other in this fast-paced simulation of speedway racing. By using three types of cards - riders, laps and racing - team managers will do the following:
- determine their riders' current forms and on their basis assign given riders to particular races;
- figure out the track properties which will reveal in which straights and bends charging opponents will reap greatest profits;
- race opponents by means of cards currently held in their hands.
Racing is the core of the game and its mechanics depends on where it takes place - in straights or bends. The former uses the upper part of each card, while the latter is played with card colours and symbols in the lower section.
The game finishes after 15 or 20 races (depending on the number of players) after which the manager whose riders accrued the biggest number of points wins.
139728.name: MCS

139729.name: Legends of the Lost Realm
139729.description:
User Summary

An early attempt at a cooperative frpg by Avalon Hill. Only ever released on the Mac, the game never caught on, but has a bit of a cult-like following to this day.

139731.description:
Description taken from official preorder page:

The Pixel Lincoln Bonuses Pack includes a Pixel Lincoln button, Pixel Sentinels, Cheat Codes, the Celebrity Custom Cards pack, the Lincoln Coin Card Pack, and a shiny penny*


Penny may not actually be shiny.


Contains all the promotional extras created during the KS campaign.
139731.name: Pixel Lincoln: Bonuses Pack
boardgameexpansion: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game

139732.name: Goal Defense
139732.description:
Train a team of underdog heroes in this hilarious action-packed defense game. Brains must overcome brawn as you protect the coveted Golden Bowl trophy from an onslaught of muscle-bound jocks!

FEATURES:

40 challenging levels of tactics, skill and speed
Hilarious characters, animated in the spirit of old-school comic books
Earn ‘use and confuse’ bonuses
Outwit your enemies’ empty skulls
Stunningly detailed and artistic scenery
Check for updates - more features to follow!




Source: The Developer Website.

139733.name: Toy Defense
139733.description:
Test your courage and skills as a military leader at the height of World War I in Toy Defense, an exciting Tower Defense game! Don’t let enemies get to your base! Help toy soldiers survive through attacks, protect your base from enemy airplanes, tanks, airships and overcome unexpected traps with the help of different kinds of weapons. Earn stars, strengthen your towers, improve soldiers and buy upgrades. Victory is in your hands!


48 captivating levels
Upgrade units and weapons
16 different achievements


Source: The Developer Website.

139734.name: Trivial Birmingham
139734.description:
This is a set of trivia questions about Birmingham, Michigan and surrounding area intended for play with Trivial Pursuit board, pieces and rules. Birmingham is a northern suburb of Detroit. Trivial Birmingham has six categories.

Business (Blue) - Local retailers and other merchants, past and present.
Civics (Orange) - Area government, education and community services.
Geography (Green) - Streets and other landmarks of Birmingham and surrounding Oakland County area.
History (Yellow) - People, places and events that shaped Birmingham.
Leisure (Brown) - Entertainment, the arts, sports, restaurants and other leisure time trivia.
Michigania (Pink) - Facts from all categories, about Detroit and the entire State of Michigan.

139735.name: Commando Jack
139735.description:
You are Commando Jack, the baddest, meanest, toughest soldier planet Earth has to offer, and it’s up to you to save the world from alien invasion. Repel attacks by placing towers on the map, but that’s not all—when you need that extra bit of firepower just jump in your turret and take those suckers down in first person mode!

Game Features

Seamlessly mixes tower defense with first-person-shooter gameplay. Totally unique.
Tons of levels make for hours of gameplay.
Universal build; plays great on iPhone, iPod touch and iPad.
Stunning graphics, destroy the invaders in full 3D.
Use well thought-out tactics as you place turrets, slow the enemy down then take them out.




Source: The Publisher Website.

139736.name: Rules for the Napoleonic period
139736.description:
Rules for Napoleonic miniatures war games. The rules are primarily for use with 25mm figures, though the ground scale can be adjusted for different size figures. Each figure and commander is assigned a points value, so players can create armies with a set number of points.

Players form up their miniature units based on their points values and use them to recreate actual or hypothetical Napoleonic battles. The terrain is varied and is supplied by the gamers. The rules concisely cover movement, combat and morale effects. Battle casualities are determined with dice rolls and the use of a rotating casualty disc "tool" (which the players have to assemble from 2 pieces of card stock and a pin.

139737.name: Naval Wargame Rules for the Napoleonic Wars 1793-1815
139737.description:
(Excerpt from the Introduction): These rules have been formulated with the period 1793-1815 (French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars) in mind, although such was the progress of Naval Warfare at the time, they could, with the preparation of suitable Ship Definitions, be used for any period during the eighteenth and first half of the nineteenth centuries.

Ground scale is 1:2400. Ship scale is 1:1200, although the rules may be modified for other scales. Measurements are in mm. Time scale is 1 move=1 minute.

There are data for a number of different types of ships ranging from frigates to the vaunted ships-of-the-line. Players use scale models to recreate historical or hypothetical naval engagements. The concise rules cover wind direction, movement, and gunnery. Dice rolls are used to generate random amounts of damage and gunfire accuracy.

These rules were published by Navwar in the United Kingdom.

139738.name: Greek Naval Warfare
139738.description:
A set of rules for naval war gaming in the Ancient era published by the London Wargames Section. The author, Ed Smith, is also the designer of the Avalon Hill game, Trireme, which covers the same topic.

Equipment Needed:
A board
Miniature ships
Movement cards
Average dice (a d6 numbered 2,3,3,4,4,5)
Normal dice
A deck of playing cards (for optioonal rules)

A homemade board (about poster board (22"x28")) consists of 2.5 cm x 2 cm rectangles; each row is offset from the adjacent rows.

Turn Sequence:
1. Wind change (optional rule)
2. Hole plugging
3. Write Manoeuvers (this is a British game design)
4. Movement
5. Oar and crew transfers
6. Archery
7. Oar raking results
8. Ramming results
9. Grappling and backwatering
10. Boarding action results
11. Morale

The player who returns home with the most vessels (including prizes) is the winner in general. Players may agree on other victory conditions, perhaps within the framework of a campaign.

139739.name: Trenches II
139739.description:
DIG FOR VICTORY! TRENCHES II wants you to join the fight – on iPad! Wage a bigger, more dangerous world war, as new nations join the struggle. Fight an epic campaign through an expanded world map. Engage the enemy in more realistic, treacherous battlefields. And defeat foes with new devastating artillery and elite forces.
The Great War has arrived and it’s time to take to the trenches again!

SURVIVE LARGER, REALISTIC BATTLEFIELDS ON IPAD
Deploy more units in a bigger and brighter battlefield. Fight through the “Fog of War”, as you steer troops through trenches, wire, tank traps and landmines. Use the environment to flank the enemy – or take cover.
BATTLE ENEMIES IN MULTIPLAYER MODES
Wage a real world war as you compete in Global Multiplayer campaigns via Game Center. Or dominate your opponents in WiFi and Bluetooth enabled multiplayer modes!

CHOOSE YOUR PATH TO VICTORY
Lead the troops through over 50 locations in a non-linear campaign that spans the European continent. Customize your army from more than 20 different units from riflemen, spies, cavalry, tanks and more.
MORE NATIONS JOIN THE FIGHT
Choose your side and play as the British, Germans – or French!

BRING IN THE CAVALRY!
Lead the charge with all-new military units and weapons. Crush your enemies with flamethrowers, cluster bombs, rail guns, and the ultimate World War I vehicle – the tank.
Fight the good fight! Enlist in TRENCHES II now!

Source: The Publisher Website.

139743.name: Donelson Breakout
139743.description:
Donelson Breakout covers the Confederate attempt to escape from Grant's siege of Fort Donelson. It uses the Age of Rifles system, for a fast, low to moderate complexity, brigade-level game of ACW battles. Interactive Sequence of play, orders, and a modern, fire-based combat system (no odds optimising!). To win, you have to use your army like a 19th century commander. Maintaining morale is the key. Running away will inspire defeatism in your troops just as heavy losses, but no side will emerge unscratched when encountering the enemy. Among all this you have to contend with multiple subordinates on a battlefield where no information can be sent faster than a rider can go. How you are able to orchestrate your leaders to enable effective concentration of force will decide the battle.

The system combines a grand tactical perspective (battle strategy, not micromanagement) with a focus on a historically sound use of your units. Four pages of basic rules aim at an easy entry into the world of pre-industiral command and combined arms with four types of orders and assault combat, cavalry charges, and artillery bombardment. Nine pages of full rules add concepts such as additional order types, written orders (although markers are available for those who do not wish to write), reaction charges, and enfilading fire. Finally, 2 pages of Advanced and Optional rules add hidden movement, division level doctrine, and others.

Scale:
400m per hex
1 hour per turn
brigade level units
Individual army and division commanders

139744.name: Dust Warfare: Campaign Book Icarus
boardgameexpansion: Dust Warfare: Core Rulebook
139744.description:
Game description from the publisher:

While the battle for Zverograd continues to rage, the Allies seek to gain a firmer foothold and strengthen their presence in the area by launching a daring series of raids upon Zverograd’s Axis-controlled airfield. Campaign Book: Icarus is a supplement for Dust Warfare that introduces a host of new aerial rules, plus much more. New special abilities like Air Superiority give jets the edge in dogfighting, while new platoon upgrades and a variant battle-builder take the war to new heights!

139745.description:
A tactical football game. Saturday afternoon football without the Sunday morning aches, bruises and sore muscles. Ther are no punts, your team has four downs to score. The team scoring five touchdaowns first wins. Clipping and downfield blocks are encouraged.

The counters represent individual players on each team. Players are rated for strength, speed, receiving and passing ability. Before the game starts, players "draft" a team from the available counters.

A ball counter is used and is possessed by the ball carrier. Offense lines up first with all players at or behind the line of scrimmage. Defens then lines up on the other side of the line of scrimmage.

The play starts when the center snaps the ball to the quarterback. To keep control of the game, only five of the offense's players will move to be followed by five of the defense's players. This allows players to set up blocks and maneuver around to gain a positional advantage. The remainder of each team moves next. Passes, laterals or handoffs are attempted in the second move action. A die roll determines if a pass is completed based on the pass distance and the passer's passing ability. Incomplete passes end the play. Receivers catching the ball use their speed to run for as much yardage as possible and defensive players attempt to minimize the yardage gained by tackling the receiver.

There are no set plays drawn up in the rules, so players draw up their own plays in the dirt by using a stick (not really, but that's how you should approach the game).
139745.name: Sandlot Football

139746.name: Halcyon Players Codex v1.1
139746.description:
From the back of the book:

2120 A.D.

Following planetary geomagnetic reversal, successive waves of catastrophic events pounded the continents without reprieve over the course of nearly a year. Fire fell from the skies, crashing to the ground, exposing giant chasms that had apparently lain dormant and undiscovered for aeons. Plagues swept the lands, indiscriminately thinning the ranks of humans. Seismic eruptions toppled skyscrapers and sent towering tsunamis crashing against densely inhabited coastal cities. Around the world, loss of life was catastrophic. Making matters worse, reports began streaming in from areas surrounding the great chasms of strange humanoid, even demonic beings permeating the wilderness. At the same time, ascetics around the world began having revelations, even claiming to have unlocked the secrets to wielding godly power and conjuring miracles.

Years have passed and the world is still rebuilding from the great Tribulation of eight years prior. From the ashes of Manhattan Island, the new city of Halcyon is being constructed. In this new city of opportunity, beneath the towering skyscrapers and the gleaming arcology, wars have begun over who will claim the spoils and rise to power in what is to become the keystone city of the Federation. The Federation and its military, foreign governments, megacorporations, organized crime syndicates, arms dealers, drug runners, fanatics, anarchists, and countless other factions all enter the fray to control the rise (or demise) of Halcyon and place their claim on the future of civilization. All eyes are upon this highly-coveted and contested city-state. And for good reason.

As Halcyon goes, so does the world.

The Players Codex is a complete rulebook for GMs and players. This book contains core concepts, character races, character creation rules, skills, game mechanics, magic rules, spell and summoning lists, historical narrative, designer notes, GM guide, campaign design guide, creatures & NPCs, and advanced rules along with a load of equipment and vehicle listings.

139747.description:
Rome, 1253 AUC: The Republic and the Empire thrive. Arenas dot the landscape. Warriors from lands both known and unknown perform upon the sands for the chance at freedom, riches, and eternal glory. Many choose this life, some are condemned to it -- they will face men, beasts, and creatures of myth, all for the favor of the crowd.

Arena Rex is a table-top miniatures game of gladiatorial combat. Battles of 3 to 8 combatants per side are recommended, and take approximately 30 to 40 minutes to play. Simple, intuitive rules offer myriad tactical possibilities. Maneuver and arena terrain play key roles in the game along with a fatigue-based activation system that twists a traditional round structure in new and exciting ways.

Arena Rex is a world inspired by the most exciting eras of antiquity. The myth, hearsay, and superstition that riddles accounts of these periods is pervasive, and key historical changes lead to a setting that is both familiar and incredible. The Roman Republic endures, as does the Gallo-Roman Empire. The kingdom of Aegyptus is a tributary of the Roman Republic and ruled directly by an Antonian king and Ptolemaic queen. The Atlantic is not the barrier it once was, and men from the twilight lands of the north and natives of the far west join in commerce and warfare. The year is 1253 AUC and this is not the world you know.
139747.name: Arena Rex
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast: Diógenes Busca Juego 04 – El doble filo del Crowdfunding

139748.name: Wayfinder (Issue 8 - Feb 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Aboleth-Tainted Ancestry: Feats of the Deep
Boarding Ships for Fun and Profit
A Crew to Defend Her Seafaring Archetypes
Curse of the Coral Throne: Crimson Throne as an Aquatic Campagin
Golarion Gazeteer: An Island, a Beach, and a Wreck
Golarion Gazeteer: Outer Islands of the Ironbound Archipelago
Stacking the Decks: Enchanted Figureheads for Ships of the Inner Sea
Tales of the Arcane Archaeologists: Plundering the Secrets of the Inner Seas
The Wives and the Sons and the Daughters
The Wreck of the Cayden Cailean: A Legend of Meatclaw the Reefclaw
Weal or Woe: Ulygun and the Sea Crow
Words from Many Seas: The Shackled Isles
139748.description:
From the Paizo Publishing, LLC website:

Created for fans by fans, this issue of the Wayfinder fanzine puts on a tricorne hat and ventures into the wilds of Golarion's coastal seas! Weathered sea captains, fanged beasties, player options and more await for those daring to take part in the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path or any nautical adventure! This free fanzine includes dozens of articles, including original fiction, new monsters, adventures, maps, treasure, poetry—this is just a small portion of what awaits you!

Table of contents:
1 Foreword
2 Weal or Woe: Ulygun and the Sea Crow
4 Into the Cannibal's Maw
13 The Bleached Whale
15 Blood on Blackwater
17 Black Ice Bay
18 Outer Islands of the Ironbound Archipelago
20 Prestigious: Ulfen Sea Captain
22 Magic Hoard from the Sea
24 Tempest Tossed
28 Halfen
30 A Crew to Defend Her: Seafaring Archetypes
34 Realm Building: Seas and Coasts
36 Curse of the Coral Throne
38 Wayward Rogues
40 Esoteric Order of Dagon
42 The Wreck of the Cayden Cailean
44 Weal or Woe: Outside Influence
47 Shoal Runner: A Ranger Archetype
48 Boarding Ships for Fun and Profit
50 Niko's Hunt
52 An Island, a Beach, and a Wreck
54 Tales of the Arcane Archaeologists
56 People and Places of Totra
58 Precious Cargo
60 Weal or Woe: Bountiful Troubles
62 Archetypes of the Blessed Isle
63 Words from the Many Seas: The Shackles Isles
64 Stacking the Decks: Enchanted Figureheads
65 Aboleth-Tainted Ancestry: Feats of the Deep
66 The Wives and the Sons and the Daughters
68 Bestiary
81 Variations of Vegepygmies
84 Caller's Rise
86 The Colloquium of Abendego
88 The Jinx: Parts 2
91 OGL
93 Open Call

139749.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Mönchengladbach
139749.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Mönchengladbach
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, very similar to Monopoly , moving by turn -
Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instruction of space landed on, buys - if possible and/or preferable - votes;
major difference compared with Monopoly;
"chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Mönchengladbach - question cards give you additional chances/bonuses finding correct answers

139750.name: Malle Getallen: Optellen en aftrekken
139750.description:
Malle Getallen (Crazy Numbers) is a Quartett with math exercises. The game is played with deck of cards, which is divided into sets of four cards, each with its own symbol. On each card, there is a math exercise (add or substract from 0 to 20).

Each player starts the game with six cards. On his turn, a player may ask another player for a card with a specific symbol. If that player has that card, he reads the exercise out load. If the asking player gives the correct answer, he gains the card, and gets to go again. If he does not give the correct answer, or if the other player does not have the card that was asked for, the asking player gains the card from the deck, and his turn ends.

When a player has collected a complete set of four cards, he sets them aside and gains one point. The game ends when all sets have been set aside; the player with the most points wins the game.

139751.name: Het Klokkijken kaartspel
139751.description:
With this Dutch game you practice to read the digital and the analog clock.

The game has two different sides:
- If you play with the domino side, is about matching the same times on top of each other. Thus, one quarter past 9 fits with 9.15 or with the correct drawing of the clock.

- If you play with the other side, you may submit series, add cards for other players, or even steal cards from other players!
You can play this by ranking the times by earlier - later!

139752.name: Depression Quest
139752.description:
Depression Quest is an interactive fiction game where you play as someone living with depression. You are given a series of everyday life events and have to attempt to manage your illness, relationships, job, and possible treatment. This game aims to show other sufferers of depression that they are not alone in their feelings, and to illustrate to people who may not understand the illness the depths of what it can do to people.

Source: The Game Website.

139753.name: Kaboom!
139753.description:
Kaboom! is a card game for two to five players. The objective of this game is to, well…blow stuff up. You are under attack by well-armed and not-so-polite enemies. You can erect walls to protect yourself, and lob all kinds of incendiary devices at your enemies. But they will be doing the same to you. If they destroy all of your walls and take you out, then it’s Kaboom! You get the picture.

Game play is very simple. Players have a hand of cards that are made up of four different types that can be used to attack their opponents and defend against incoming attacks. As the game progresses, the players will have their protective walls slowly whittled down to nothing. This leaves them exposed and the next attack from any opponent that cannot be blocked immediately eliminates the player from winning the game, but does not remove them from the game. As soon as this happens, the endgame is triggered and the Endgame cards come into play. The Endgame cards are special cards that keep eliminated players in the game to hinder all those who are still in the running to win the game.

The game ends when there is only one player left who has not been eliminated. This player, being the only one to survive the battle, is automatically the winner.

139754.name: Trust
139754.description:
Economic game in which players play either company, bank or government. A player puts down a package of asset and debt cards - but only assets are face-up. The next player can either accept the package, add cards and pass it on, or doubt that the assets cover the debt cards. The wronged player gets permanent debts, and at the end of the game, the player with the lowest debts wins.
Each player also has a rating that influences his/her hand cards, so the challenge is not entirely an uninformed decision.

139755.name: Treasure, Treasure!
139755.description:
This treasure hunt is played on a spiral board; there is a treasure in the middle that players are trying to reach. Each player is secretly assigned the color of one of the pawns, and each player gets three cards.
The active player rolls two dice and multiplies the result with the number of one of the cards in his/her hands to move the pawn of the same color (as the card) the corresponding number of fields. If the pawn lands on a spiral, it changes positions with another pawn; if it lands on a feather, it can move the double distance.
When the first pawn reaches the center field, the secret colors are revealed, and the player who has the same color as the winning pawn wins the game.

139756.name: Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds
139756.description:
User description
A typical multiplayer beat'em-up in the tradition of "Golden Axe" and "Guardian Heroes". One or more players control small characters in a side-scrolling environent, defeating multiple enemies attacking from all sides, gradually advancing to the left or right depending on stage. Each stage ends with a boss fight. Characters have special moves and gain experience points as they move on; these experience points are used to "level up" the character. These levels are also saved in between gaming sessions, so the first stages will become easier and easier as your characters level up while the enemy doesn't.

From the XBLA description
A spinoff to the fightning game "Phantom Breaker, "Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds" is a cooperatove action ame for up to four players. Cute versions of the series' characters dash around the screen in this action packed titles. Defeat ememies to raise your characters' leels and freely assign skills to your liking. Also enjoy head to head fights in the Battleground mode.

139757.name: Toy Stunt Bike 2
139757.description:
User summary

A simple two-dimensional bike racing game where your avatar races on a toy Stunt Bike over various stuff set on a working desk. This sequel to Toy Stunt Bike features split screen 2 player racing.

139758.name: Monopoly: America's World War II
139758.description: This is a redo of the old classic, available as a limited edition only through the National World War II Museum in New Orleans, LA. The properties become famous land and sea battles in both the ETO and PTO, ending in VE Day and VJ Day. There are six new tokens - B-17 Bomber, combat boots, cathedral radio, LCVP, Sherman tank and American combat helmet. Chance and Community Chest turn into Allies and Home Front. Houses turn into camps and hotels turn into headquarters.

139759.name: The Stewardship Game
139759.description:
"This game was designed to be fun, but also to teach important principles about Christian Stewardship. The game emphasizes that being a good steward is a way of life, and that it is about the daily decisions we make in the use of out time, talent and treasure." (From the teacher's packet included with the game.)

Players roll a die to move around the board, reading aloud from one of four types of cards that match the square they landed on, then acting out what the card says to do. If the player lands on a "Word on Stewardship" space, they draw a card from that stack and have thirty seconds to look up the Bible verse listed on it. (Bible and timer are NOT included in the game pieces.) If the player cannot find the verse in time, they move backwards on the board. If they do find the verse, play halts until the player reads the verse aloud.

Play continues until one player lands on the "Well done good and Faithful Steward" by exact roll. This person is the winner.

139760.name: Paper RPG
139760.description:
User summary

A light hearted and simple travesty of role playing games, this is merely a series of still screens where the player chooses between two or more choices, which leads to different routes. Most routes lead to death. Making the exact right choices will lead to the end.

The game is played fully within one hour.

139761.name: Steel Towers
139761.description:
Steel Towers is a game of city building, monster attacks, and high profits! After years of relentless attacks by aliens, gorillas, and monsters, Scraper City has finally banished these nuisances to a holding facility in the next state, where they are controlled by electronic collars. Downtown is ready to grow again! As real estate moguls in this once-again booming city, players compete to make the most money by building Skyscrapers to attract rent-paying tenants.

However, the Skyscrapers that make the most money are in the best Neighborhoods. Players hold cards which give them the right to build Skyscrapers along specific streets, while attracting valuable Businesses, knocking down unsightly Abandoned Buildings, and cleaning up Junkyards. However, the moguls try to foil each other by taking control of Mutant Monsters, Giant Gorillas, or Alien Attacks, making construction in Scraper City perilous at best.

The novel game mechanic for determining revenue from Skyscrapers at the end of each turn means that the most thoughtful strategy will prevail! The winning mogul is the one with the most money after ten years (turns) of building and collecting rent. Steel Towers is a unique game with easy-to-learn rules, but deep strategy.

139762.name: Terra
139762.description:
Terra is new semi-cooperative board game from Touko Tahkokallio.
The game is targeted to school classes and the theme is environmental. In the game players are collectively trying to save the world from the environmental catastrophes. Players win or lose the game collectively, but still you can count who's got the most successful country.

In Terra you play five rounds and every player has one turn in every round. Every player represents a country and all players together represent the international community.
1. At the start of the round you remove old development tiles and turn over six new development tiles.
2. Then first player starts his turn. On his turn player can do next actions as many times as he can afford in free order:
-Buy one development tile.
-Activate development tile with his/her worker.
-Donate money to planetary fund to avoid catastrophes.
-Trade with other players (one on one)
-Remove catastrophe markers (with two money)
After player has made as many actions as she/he wishes, it's next players turn.
3. After every player has had turn, then global warming kicks in. First you remove two carbon cubes from the atmosphere and then temperature marker goes up as many places as there is carbon cubes left. (New carbon cubes emerge when you burn coal in power plants.)
4. And then environmental catastrophes kick in. The temperature track tells you how many catastrophe cards you turn over. Now the chairman of the international community (i.e. starting player of this round) decides how to use planetary funds to overcome catastrophes. If he/she can't defeat catastrophes they will hit every player.
5. At the end of the round every country has to feed its workers and produce needed energy. Player loses points and workers if she/he can't. And finally chairman of the international community marker goes to next player.

During the game you get points from some of the development tiles (cities, schools, laboratories) and at the end of the game you get points from workers, money and all your development tiles. Catastrophes make you lose money when they happen and points at the end.

To succeed you collectively most have more than 50 points (minimum 0, maximum 100). If the game is played in the classroom with many copies, then you can also see which group got the best overall score.

139764.name: Torment: Tides of Numenera
videogamehonor: 2016 PAX Curse Award Best RPG of the Year Winner
139764.description:
From the Developer Website:

Single player, story-driven, isometric role-playing game. PC, Mac and Linux. DRM-free.
Languages supported: English, French, German, Italian, Polish, Russian, Spanish

Torment: Tides of Numenera™ continues the thematic legacy of the critically acclaimed Planescape: Torment™. Set in Monte Cook's new tabletop role-playing world, Numenera™, the newest Torment asks: What does one life matter?

Numenera's Ninth World is a fantastic vision of a world in which massive civilizations have risen and fallen - disappeared, transcended, overwhelmed, or destroyed - and left their cities, monuments, and artifacts behind. As each rose and fell, their achievements became part of the accumulated detritus of eons... but much of it did not decay. And now this assortment of ancient power is there for the taking, ever-present, underfoot. The humans of the Ninth World take and use what they can. They call these wonders (and horrors) the numenera.

One of these humans discovers a way to use the numenera to grow strong, to cheat death, to skip across the face of centuries in a succession of bodies. But he discovers an unexpected side effect: You.

Torment™ is a game of complex and nuanced morality, deep and reactive choice and consequence, and immersion into a new and strange vision. You will chart a course through bizarre dimensions, across the face of a vastly different world. You will earn companions along the way, and discover their value - perhaps through their strengths, perhaps more literally by selling them. Throughout it all, you will choose a path that will lead inexorably to an ending that stems naturally from your actions, facing adversaries who harness powers beyond your comprehension, and who will ultimately force you to face yourself and answer the question: What does one life matter?

139765.name: Philosophie: Das Spiel
139765.description:
The main part of the game are 30 "quotes" of 20 different philosophers. Each player gets on philosopher at random at the start.

Each round the starting player selects one of his quotes read it aloud. The every other player "answers" with one of his philosopher's quote. At the and of the round each player has three votes "0", "1" and "2" and has to vote for one othewr player.

Points are awarded for 3 differnt categories: Sum of the votes, Wininng a round, losing a round.

Whoever "wins" the first of the three 36 point in total or 5 wins or 5 losses (cynics-score), wins the game.

139766.description: Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Extreme Danger – a boxed expansion pack for Flash Point: Fire Rescue – includes six different building configurations. When combined with the Flash Point: Fire Rescue - 2nd Story expansion, four additional building configurations can be created. In addition, it includes firefighter-specific miniatures (with colored bases), as well as tokens for explosive objects, hazardous equipment/chemical spills, and fire-proof doors. Also includes a box to hold all previous expansions.
139766.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Extreme Danger
boardgameexpansion: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Extreme Danger Kickstarter Bonus Pack

139767.name: Original World Rummy
139767.description:
From the Passport Instructions to the "Original" World Rummy by Adell:

"Original" World Rummy is a game designed to combine the timeless appeal of playing cards with the impact of Backgammon and the strategy of chess.

Instructions are printed in 26 languages for the enjoyment of your family and friends around the world. Besides the languages listed in this entry, the rules are also printed in Farsi (Persian) and Swahili.

There are 106 tiles (each measuring 27 mm x 33 mm) used in the game. There are 2 jokers and 104 numbered tiles. The numbered tiles are in four colors: Black, Red, Blue and Yellow. Think of these as card suits. Each color consists of 13 "ranks" (numbered 1 to 13) and there are 2 sets of 1-13 in each color.

The tiles are mixed up and placed face down in the middle of the table. Each player draws one and the player drawing the lowest number goes first. 14 tiles are drawn by each player into their rack.

Objective: The first player to play out all their tiles in their rack wins the hand. The winner scores the tile points that are left in their opponent's racks. First player to get 500 points is the winner.

A player's turn begins with drawing a tile. Players lay down melds of 3 or more tiles ("sets" of the same rank or "runs" (consecutive ranks in the same color)). Once each player has laid down 1 meld, they can play on the melds of other players. If the player can't play on their own or another person's meld, they must pass. There's a sand timer, so player's lose their turn if they spend too much time analyzing their options.

Splitting runs and sets:
As an example, if you have a Black 7 tile, you can split a Black run 9-8-7-6-5 into 2 runs - Black 5-6-7 and Black 7-8-9. If you have a Red 8-9, you can split 4-10's (Red, Black, Blue, Blue) into run Red 8-9-10 and set of 3-10's (Black, Blue, Blue).

The Jokers have some restrictions on their use, but they can be powerful options for a player's strategies. If you have the right tile, you can play it to replace a Joker, but then you must play the Joker right away; you cannot place it back in your rack.

Besides the tiles, the game comes with 4 tile racks (some assembly required) and 2 sand timers.

139768.name: Final Fantasy VII (ShenZhen)
139768.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Final Fantasy VII.




Final Fantasy VII (simplified Chinese: 最终幻想7; traditional Chinese: 最終幻想7; pinyin: Zuì Zhōng Huàn Xiǎng 7), also called Core Crisis (Chinese: 核心危机; pinyin: Hé Xīn Wēi Jī), is a Chinese unofficial, unlicensed "Shanzhai" remake of the 1997 role-playing video game Final Fantasy VII, originally developed by Square for the PlayStation. The two-dimensional "port" was developed and published by the Chinese company ShenZhen Nanjing Technology for the SUBOR entertainment system, a clone of Nintendo's Famicom console (known internationally as the Nintendo Entertainment System). The cartridge itself is unique, as it is structurally different from licensed Famicom cartridges in terms of hardware and programming.

The game features many gameplay elements of the original Final Fantasy VII, including a three-member party structure and adaptations of the game's subsystems. The items, spells and equipment available to the player are based upon those in the original game, and although a large number have been omitted along with optional characters and some side quests, the original story was reproduced in very minute detail. The game was received with mixed reception, cited as an impressive achievement but at the same time criticized for its difficulty and choice of a target console.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Fantasy VII (Famicom)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139769.description:
Prepare for invasion! Robotech RPG Tactics is a tactical miniatures game set in the Robotech universe. While the 1/285th scale game pieces can be used as a companion to the Robotech RPG, the game system is designed to be played as a tabletop miniatures game. Players build armies of multiple squadrons of mecha to fight it out in scenario-driven, objective-based game play. Take command of the fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force (UEDF) valiantly defending Earth from alien annihilation – or lead the massive clone armies of the Zentraedi Armada to recover an alien artifact of immense power and enslave humankind. Depending on the faction, and their choice of mecha, a player's army may include anywhere from two game pieces to as many as you desire! The rules are scalable from small skirmishes to mass combat with hundreds per side.

Robotech RPG Tactics uses a dynamic turn system. Players trade off activating squadrons during each turn, ensuring that a player never has to sit and wait while his opponent moves and attacks with his entire army. By using alternating activation of squadrons, the game's action unfolds at a fast and furious pace, allowing large scale battles to be easily carried out in a single evening. Each player receives a number of Command Points each turn based on the number of mecha they have on the field, and the quality of their officers. Command Points are spent throughout the turn on maneuvers such as boosted movement, devastating weapon salvos, breakneck dodging counterattacks, and potent special abilities.

The wide variety of mecha in the boxed game bring to bear the myriad and awesome weapon systems from the Robotech universe to lay waste to your foes. Even the battlefield itself can alter over the course of the game as buildings are leveled by destruction unleashed during the battle.

139770.name: Space Relics
139770.description:
In Space Relics, each player is a space pirate racing against the others to get the most items and most valuable artifacts out of an intergalactic museum.

The game board has a grid for the platform tiles that players will need to move around in order to reach the fixed gallery tiles where the items and artifacts can be found. The platform and galleries (except for the center gallery tile) are set up randomly each game.

Players start the game with 12 action points to use for movement and relocating tiles. However, the action points are reduced by 1 each round to simulate the space suits running out of air and power.

Items and artifacts are randomly drawn from two decks of cards. However, the primary artifact, The Heart of Sol, is always in the center of the board.

Art by Steve Thomas (www.stevethomasart.com)

139771.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Star Trek: Attack Wing is a tactical space combat miniatures game, featuring pre-painted ships from the Star Trek Universe.

By using the FlightPath maneuver system* (licensed from Fantasy Flight Games), players engage in exploration and combat, traversing sprawling Star Trek space maps made available via an in-store Organized Play program. As commander, players have the ability to customize, upgrade, and assign famous crewmembers to their fleets, which feature ships from the series' prominent empires and forces as well as special stats and abilities, and unique maneuvers on separate Combat Dials.

Star Trek: Attack Wing is a standalone game which uses the core rule set of FFGs' FlightPath game system with a Star Trek twist, but is not compatible with other FlightPath games from FFG. The FlightPath maneuver system used in Star Trek: Attack Wing is based on the original game design by Jason Little.

user summary

"SOX" covers a description of the Saar-Lorraine-Luxemburg containment zone and a related adventure ("Hoffnungsstrahlen", Rays of Hope). It is a French-German cooperation.

user summary
