139778.description:
This is a fan based print & play expansion to Dominion featuring 18 new cards.

War and conflict takes its toll from land and men. Weary nobles fight over every piece of land, both by soldiers in the field, but also by deception and ploys. What yesterday was a fruitful part of your country might tomorrow be a ruined and burned land, or belong to another regent.

Warmonger focuses on player interaction with more added Attack cards and Action cards that mess with players in different ways. And then there are ways to interacts with Victory cards, both your own and your oppponents. Victory cards are no longer safe when they are in your deck.

Card Breakdown (note that some cards are dual, so still just 18 cards)
- 4 Victory cards (three supply; one basic, the 15VP Empire card)
- 8 Attack cards
- 2 Reaction cards
- 1 Treasure card (in supply)
- 15 Action cards

In the file section you will find the Rules PDF and the Card Sheet PDF; all you need to print & play.
139778.name: Warmonger (Fan Expansion to Dominion)
boardgameexpansion: Dominion
Dominion: Special Edition

139779.description:
You will manage and guide the migration of five species of birds. However, not every specie has the same flight habits flight and do not travel the same distance. You will therefore have to adaptat your strategy and to play the right cards at the right time, pay attention to obstacles, and keep an eye on the opponent's game ...

Each player must manage migration up to 5 birds (Brant, Black Kite, Black-winged Stilt, European Bee-eater and teal) to send them to the destination. Players will straight ahead at maximum 4 colonies simultaneously. A turn begins and ends with still 3 cards in hand, and each turn, each player may put a card in the game to start a colony or complete one (provided that the number of birds on the card is equal or lower than the previous). On the cards are the target for each type of bird (a number of cards of this type of bird), the distribution of the number of birds for each type of bird and if it is migrant birds day only, night only, or day and night. Because the maps corresponding to phases of flight day will be put face up, face down but those night! Rather than place a card, the player can if desired separate colony in two of his game, and reassociate into two colonies.
At the end of his turn, a player must discard a card from his hand and complement 3 by drawing cards.

Once a player has reached the goal of a specie (a number of cards depending on the type of bird), he puts his colony in a heap next to his game and can not migrate these birds . The last card that will put equal to the number of points that this bird brings him. The opponent may still him in his game to migrate this type of bird.

Players will also play cards "Dangers" (Hunter day, night light pollution and destruction of natural day and night), which can steal a card from an opponent among current flight phases or among birds which have reached their destination.

The game ends when one of the two players that get the fifth type of bird, the two players combined. The winner is whoever has the most points (numbers of birds arrive at their destination for every type of bird).
139779.name: Migrato

boardgamehonor: 2013 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
139780.description:
Merlin stole a spellbook to his father then was captured by the witch. His friends, Viviane, Lancelot, Guinevere and Arthur went looking for him and were able to deliver him ...
Remains to reach the village of Broceliande to give the spellbook back to its owner but they are pursued by the monstrous cat Morpnage ...

In this game, players join forces to lead all the characters to the village before being caught by the cat.
Players will send (literally) spells on the track
according to a precise technique indicated by a special dice.

According to the case indicated by the spell, players will advance a character, use a secret passage, give a character invisibility or reverse the hourglass. But, these spells can also have side effects that will waste precious time to players.

The cat wall advance whenever the hourglass will have elapsed (ie once per minute)or whenever and 3 spells have been sent off to the track spells. If the cat catch up a character on the board he or she will be eaten.
139780.name: Merlin Zinzin
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
boardgamepodcastepisode: DdJ 031. Pedro Soto en el polo. Roberto Fraga.

139781.name: Gangs City
139781.description:
You are a gang leader and your aim is to become the Patron of the city. In order to do this, you will recruit and use your henchmen to manage traffic and take control of the neighborhoods, in short, anything that will get you up into the Mob.

Gangs City is based on a mechanism of laydown tiles where the characters perform different actions (fight, recruitment or traffic) according to the direction of their tile and where their location. During a turn, you place your characters, one by one, trying to assess the tactics your opponents to not let yourself overwhelmed by the other gangs.

139782.name: Radiance Masters Guide
139782.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maps, monsters, traps, treasure, and more...

This supplement for the free Radiance Players Guide contains a wealth of resources to enrich your adventures in Tesla's gilded world of electrotech.

Inside this 212-page game book, you will discover:

Story ideas, campaign concepts, narrative roles, and alternate approaches to running the game.
Over 130 creatures of all types including aberrations, celestials, constructs, dragons, fey, fiends, mutants, and more. * Includes new monsters and void-faring beings that are well-suited to a world of Burroughs, Lovecraft, Tesla, and Verne.
Over 50 templates to quickly customize monsters.
Lethal traps, unpleasant hazards, and tempting eldritch artifacts to challenge the most stalwart and careful heroes.
24 detailed maps with encounter tables.
GM cheat sheets to speed up play.

139783.name: Hulks & Horrors
139783.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are not alone in the Universe, but we have few friends. As we emerged on the galactic stage, we found a universe stripped bare of sentient life by a great Plague, leaving only the wild beasts and twisted plague horrors wandering the ruined hulks of lost civilizations.

We are the Surveyors. We explore the uncharted sectors of space and hunt these ruins for the treasures they contain and the riches they might bring to what sentient life remains. We are not brave, merely foolhardy and desperate. Those who survive become rich beyond dreams. Very few survive.

Hulks & Horrors is a science-fiction roleplaying game of galactic exploration and adventure for 2 or more players ages 13 and up. Inside you will find:

Complete rules for characters up to Level 6 and beyond
7 character classes: Pilot, Scientist, Soldier, Psyker, Hovering Squid, Omega Reticulan, and Bearman.
Easy to learn old-school inspired game rules and combat system
Weapons, armor, and equipment inspired by classic science-fiction
Spaceship construction and combat rules
Random tables for creating whole sectors of space
Loot generation rules
Dozens of alien monsters as well as guides for designing your own
Dungeon-mastering advice for sandbox space exploration
Optional rules for customizing Hulks & Horrors

139784.name: The Freedom Ring (SUPERS! Edition)
139784.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to TGI's The Freedom Ring! This is a supplement for use with Beyond Belief Games' Supers! The Comic Book Role Playing Game, a rules-lite superhero RPG.

Inside you'll find:

The Freedom Ring: Stats and detailed origins for Freedom Star, Itsy-Bitsy, Maiden America, Min-Max, and Thunderbird. Although superheroes, these characters are designed to serve as well-intentioned antagonists for your team of player-character supers.
Skana!: Full stats and a detailed origin for this ocean-dwelling menace, who plagues the Freedom Ring as well as humanity as a whole.
The SUPERVERSE: The seeds of a broader universe to be developed through our on-going line of products.
Art: Character portraits for each member of the Freedom Ring and Skana, along with a small art gallery and character standees - all done by our spectacular artist, Russell Boyd.
Optional Rules for SUPERS!: New optional lifting rules, and guidelines for character advancement

139785.name: The Freedom Ring (BASH UE Edition)
139785.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to TGI's The Freedom Ring! This is a supplement for use with Basic Action Games' BASH! Ultimate Edition, a rules-lite superhero RPG.

Inside you'll find:

The Freedom Ring: Stats and detailed origins for Freedom Star, Itsy-Bitsy, Maiden America, Min-Max, and Thunderbird. Although superheroes, these characters are designed to serve as well-intentioned antagonists for your team of player-character supers.
Skana!: Full stats and a detailed origin for this ocean-dwelling menace, who plagues the Freedom Ring as well as humanity as a whole.
The SUPERVERSE: The seeds of a broader universe to be developed through our on-going line of products.
Art: Character portraits for each member of the Freedom Ring and Skana, along with a small art gallery and character standees - all done by our spectacular artist, Russell Boyd.
Optional Rules for BASH! UE: Including expanded benchmark tables for Abilities, new benchmark tables for Skills and Combat Values, expanded weapon and armor Stats, and alternate lifting rules.

139786.name: The Iron Gauntlet (SUPERS! Edition)
139786.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to TGI's The Iron Gauntlet! This is a supplement for use with Hazard Studios' and Zenith Comics' Supers! The Comic Book Role Playing Game, a rules-lite superhero RPG.

Inside you'll find:

The Iron Gauntlet: Stats and detailed origins for supervillains The Grey Ghoul, Iron Maiden, Manite, Mammoth, The Sire, and Skana. Each is the arch-enemy of one of the characters appearing in our previous publication, The Freedom Ring, but each stands on his own as a challenge to your own player character superheroes.
Violet Revolution!: Full stats and a detailed origin for this super-spinning menace, who serves as a teaser for our next planned project - The Kingdom.
The SUPERVERSE: Yet more seeds of a broader universe to be developed through our on-going line of products.
Art: Character portraits for each member of the The Iron Gauntlet and Violet Revolution, along with a small art gallery and character standees - all done by our spectacular artist, Russell Boyd.
Optional Rules for SUPERS!: New optional benchmark rules, along with new Powers, Boosts, and Ads for use in your SUPERS! games.

139787.name: Raiders of the Republic
139787.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raiders of the Republic is a campaign set in the Roman Federated Republic (RFR). The universe presented here is not is a parallel world where the Roman Republic happened in space. Although the history of the RFR does not match with our hostory, many names, places and events are parallels of their historical counterparts; however, there has been no effort to conform to historical events or biographies. This is fiction, not history, and liberties were taken to make the gaming universe interesting.

This campaign book is designed for use with the d20 MODERN Roleplaying Game by Wizards of the Coast under the terms of the Open Gaming License. However, the book is a self-contained universe description and the creative game master can adapt it to any Science Fiction RPG with minimal effort. In order to effectively use the material contained herein, it is recommended that copies of the d20 MODERN Roleplaying Game and d20 Future be available. The d20 Future Tech, Menace Manual, d20 Past and d20 Apocalypse books may also be useful, depending on the chosen campaign style, but are not essential.

139788.name: Skyfire
139788.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet SKYFIRE!! Never-before-available in any format! The newest release from Les Supérieurs corner in the WatchGuard Universe! Skyfire is the team firepower, both in actual ability and personality! Don't get in this guy's way!!

139789.name: Outbreak: Deep Space
139789.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outbreak: Deep Space is the first sci-fi module created for the award winning Zombie Survival RPG Outbreak: Undead created by the developers of the same system.
Outbreak: Deep Space pushes the boundaries of sci-fi survival horror to the edges of the universe.

Your players come face to face with mind enslaving parasites, terrifying alien races or be forced to confront the depths of their own madness!


What is Outbreak: Deep Space?

The open-world system of Outbreak: Undead has been adapted for Outbreak: Deep Space to represent the claustrophobic confines of ship corridors and space stations. The introduction of a more rapid ‘sTime’ (for “Ship Time”) allows periods of time to pass much more rapidly, meaning more Encounter checks, more dangers and a much more rapid pace to gameplay.

What is different?


Health, Damage and Combat

The most notable difference between Outbreak: Undead and Outbreak: Deep Space is that Health and Combat are handled in a much more fast and loose fashion. The complex survival strategies of Outbreak: Undead gives way to a fast-paced action-horror with streamlined combat and damage systems.

Gear

The technology system of this setting far outstrips anything we can know or understand in present day. As such, instead of individual items, all gear is built on a chosen ‘Chassis’. The character's equipment is fully defined by the different customizable features the players wish to add and there is little to no limitation to the kinds of modifications they can make to their gear. Creating gear with Tech upgrades becomes an exciting art in and of itself and will give a character that extra edge in their desperate bid for survival!

What is similar?


Objectives

Just like in the Outbreak: Undead Core System, a character can earn Survival Points (or SP) by accomplishing missions objectives and use the SP to work towards an endgame scenario for dramatic scenario conclusions.

Random Scenario Generators

no two games will ever be alike, as the ability to generate random scenario objectives, will allow a GM to experiment and weave narratives to link the randomly generated events together. Storytelling just got a lot easier now that you know the main plot points! The GM is always free to invent their own objectives and, more importantly, their own dramatic endings!

Take your Zombie (Organisms) Survival Plan into the void of DEEP SPACE, and discover why YOUR ZOMBIE SURVIVAL PLAN WILL FAIL!

139790.name: Immer mit der Ruhe
139790.description:
Objective: be the first leading all (3) of your meeples home
- moving by turns -
a 'Pachisi'-variant

Each player has a set of 3 meeples that start in his/her corner of the board. The goal is to move the meeples around the board back to the "home" section (=start). Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may throw out others meeples. Thrown ones are returned to their player's corner and must start again. The winner is the first player to move all meeples "home".
The major difference is located as red square (8 spaces) in the middle of the board, which must passed 4 times. It becomes a bottleneck, because only one meeple may move into (next step out of) it. During this period it can be thrown out easily.

139792.name: SUPERS! Quick Start
139792.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grab your cowl and boldly display your colors as you fight for justice!

Built for the SUPERS! Comic Book Role Playing Game, SUPERS! Quick Start contains all you need for you and your friends to test drive the SUPERS! RPG. Answer the call when a friendly gathering turns to mayhem. The people need heroes, Are you ready?

Within these pages you will find:

A basic understanding of the game rules set up to be easily played in a single game session.
Three PC's ready for action
A short, yet full scenario to run your players through to get a taste for the system
Standees for those that want to see how their heroes tackle the game space.
Full color art.




Supers! is a dynamic system of comic book mayhem and colorful heroes and villains set against rules that allow you to think outside the box. In fact, we encourage SUPERS! players to throw things out of the box, throw the box, set the box on fire, explode the box, and then try and recover all the pieces.

Break the chains of standard superhero rpg's and try SUPERS! Quick Start!

139793.name: Lady Pendergrass
139793.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lady Pendergrass is a delusional woman who feels she is decended from royalty. Armed with a royal scepter her goal is to take whatever she wants, because frankly she's royalty.

This release contains details a golden age villain PL 9.

This is the ninth in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

139794.name: Hive King
139794.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hive King is a professor of entomology turned a swarm-controlling egomaniac.

This release contains details a golden age villain PL 11.

This is the seventh in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

139795.name: Grenadier
139795.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grenadier was a staff sergeant in the army before he volunteered to become a super-soldier. Never one to sit on the sidelines, the Grenadier can often be found at the front of the battle.

This release contains details a golden age hero PL 8.

This is the eighth in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

139796.name: Dwarves
139796.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dwarves! Whether a lone warrior aiding his fellowship on an epic quest, or an entire band of a baker’s dozen searching for long forgotten gold, dwarves are icons of fantasy roleplaying games. They are stout warriors, hardy guardians, and lost kings.

Presented here are several options for your dwarf character, including two variant dwarf races, over a dozen feats, a half-dozen flaws, and some dwarf specific weapons, armor, and equipment, all designed to allow you to play a sturdy, strong, and possibly surprising dwarf!

139797.name: Find It!: The Bible Scavenger Hunt
139797.description:
In about all Bible trivia games, players are required to do memory dumps from their mind. In Find It! it is different. In Find It! it is different. In the game, players are allowed to look through a Bible they have, to find the answers.

Each turn, a player takes the role of a moderator, and asks a question. Players would then rush to try to find the answer in the Bible. First player to find the answer would score points.

Player to first reach a target score, or have high score after a set amount of time wins the game. The game can vary difficulty by given clues as to Old or New Testament, book, and also chapter. Players can also play with either preset cards, or have players create questions on the fly.

139798.name: Minirolly und Minigolf
139798.description:
2 different games with a similar approach: build your individual course, play it and create a new one...
Objective:
score as many points as possible by pushing the ball with a swinging hammer into target zone; repeat it 4 x and add results; if your ball leaves the course or if you don't master the obstacle ==> penalty
You can modify course and target zone up to 16 different challenges

139799.name: Kersploosh!
139799.description:
"Master a stone’s flight to the bottom of the well!

Be one with the stone from the toss to the splash. With a sharp mind and a deft touch on the Circle Pad, master the journey to the bottom of wells filled with obstacles. As you learn to maneuver each stone in free fall and complete each level, you’ll unlock more stones and wells. Embrace the challenges that lie ahead... for the flight is at hand.

Each well is designed differently, with various hazards to impede your journey. Some wells have pizzas that break apart; others contain floating cookies that will sacrifice their delicious lives to stop you from getting to the bottom. Armed with a selection of stones, such as the beefy iron ball and the fragile gem, race as fast as possible to the bottom of each well. Then turn on the StreetPass feature and share your speedy conquests with others!


Be one with the stone and race to the bottom of the well
Each stone handles differently. Master them all!
Learn to control stones, rubber balls, and even iron balls
Use the StreetPass feature to share your high scores with others"


Source: The Publisher Website.

139800.name: of Shot & Blade
139800.description:
of Shot & Blade is a boardgame of action, magic and high adventure set in the unique fantasy world of Edath where non-combat skills are as influential as combat in surviving a wild and broken world. The game allows for a variety of simple adventures to be played – skirmishes, quests, hunts, investigations, etc – and in a variety of settings.

Players split into two teams. The Adventurers Team attempt to achieve a final objective and take their squads and champions across three Locations against beasts, ravines, natives and the like, while the Nemesis Team aims to thwart them.

With each encounter, the players draw from their chosen Skills and any support they may get, and opposed players engage in a conflict where their dice rolls are influenced in a back and forth fashion until one player can do no more and so loses that particular contest, suffering the consequences.

By the time the final goal is reached the Adventurers will have succeeded or failed to acquire boons and other bonuses that can aid them in an all or nothing last ditch attempt to succeed in their mission. Adventures can be played stand alone or as part of a series.

139801.name: Player's Guide to the Seven Cities
139801.description:
From publisher blurb:


Fall In, Soldier! Plunder and Glory Await!

In Midgard’s Seven Cities, war is embraced and celebrated as nowhere else. The armies of its republics march every spring, looking for conquest, plunder, and glory. Warriors come to the cities to take their coin as mercenaries, and many have seized a lord’s title. The oracle who keeps a god in chains, the merchant-assassins of Capleon and the minotaurs and centaurs of Valera--the people of the Seven Cities don't dream small!

Will you rise in the ranks from foot soldier to legend? Or do you seek something even greater than the dreams of a broken empire?

This 33-page collection of materials provides players with a regional overview of the Seven Cities and its border states, plus a wide range of new powers and options for any Pathfinder RPG campaign, including:

New archetypes for Fighters, Druids, and Wizards
New spells and magic items including Ballista of Force, Librarian’s Robe, and Trident of Nethus
New sorcerous bloodlines for Hagblooded and Minotaur
50 new traits and 16 new feats including Blood of the Sea, Dark Dreamer, and Swordborn
An overview of the region, with its world-famous libraries, corsair fleets, and scheming rulers

139802.name: New International Track & Field
139802.description:
New International Track & Field (New International ハイパースポーツDS New International Hyper Sports DS?, "), is a sports video game by Konami for the Nintendo DS. Developed by Sumo Digital, it is the latest game in Konami's Track and Field series.

Overview

New International Track & Field features single-player career and training modes in addition to Wi-Fi multi-player between 2 to 4 players, a character-based minigame challenge mode and a worldwide player ranking system. The original Track and Field game will also be available to play.

The gameplay of New International Track & Field differs from the traditional button mashing and joystick-wiggling gameplay of the original games in that players use the motion of the stylus to set a rhythm for their character. In addition, the game will also feature uses for the DS' dual screens and you can shout encouragement for your character via the microphone to give them an extra boost. The louder you shout, the bigger the boost.

New International Track & Field features an online community at their website. Players are able to link their games to their website accounts and participate in online global scoreboards, teams, and tournaments. The site also features forums for discussion about the game.

24 events are featured in the game.
100 Metre Sprint
Long Jump
110 Metre Hurdles
Skeet Shooting
Weightlifting
400 Metre Distance
Steeplechase
Archery
Javelin
Cycling
Triple Jump
Hammer
Discus
Shot Put
Breaststroke
100 Metre Backstroke
High Jump
High dive
Double trap
Springboard
Pole vault
Rowing
Horizontal bar

Source: Wikipedia, "New International Track & Field", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

139803.name: Player's Guide to the Wasted West
139803.description:
From publisher blurb:


Weird horror and forbidden sorcery!

Once the height and center of human civilization, the Wasted West was brought low by hubris and alien wizardry. Now all that remains are the wind-scoured bones of mighty cities and their doomed citizens. Only the bravest, most reckless or most desperate adventurers dare to face its dangers…which is, of course, where you come in.

This 30-page collection of materials provides players with a regional overview of the Wasted West, plus a wide range of new powers and options for any Pathfinder RPG campaign, including:

7 new archetypes for Summoners, Magi, Clerics, Druids, Rangers, Witches and Wizards
New spells and magic items including Call Goblin Warriors, Wastewalker’s Alacrity, and Deadly Rope
3 new sorcerous bloodlines including Ghoulish, Goblin, and Realms Beyond, plus cavalier orders of the wastes
35 new traits and 18 wild new feats including Vril Scavenger, Tentacled Freak, and Alien Monster Hunter
An overview of the region, its goblin tribes and powerful mages – and of course the time-trapped Old Ones who roam its desolate places

139804.name: King for a Day
139804.description:
From the Back Cover

King for a Day is a systemless fantasy sandbox campaign written in the style of Lovecraft, with more creep than gore. Set in a traditional Anglo-Saxon shire, the campaign is an extensive toolkit of people, places, and strange events all culminating in a horrific and unreal finale.

With nearly 200 NPCs and dozens of unique locations and stories, King for a Day promises to provide many hours of gaming entertainment.

King for a Day is recommended for mature players.

139806.name: Mass Effect 3: Citadel
videogamehonor: 2013 Spike (VGX) Best DLC of the Year Nominee
139806.description:
User Summary

Mass Effect 3: Citadel is a DLC meant more as a way for the player to say goodbye to Commander Shepard's crew rather than expand on the events of Mass Effect 3.

The Normandy needs to go through some maintenance, so Shepard along with the rest of the crew are given shore leave. Soon things go awry, as an unknown faction recruits a group of mercenaries to kill Shepard. The main mission has a humorous tone, very different from the base game. Urdnot Wrex joins the fray and becomes a temporary squad mate. Once you have finished the main mission you can also set up battles in an arena with an expanded rooster of squad mates, which includes Jack, Miranda Lawson, Jacob Taylor, Grunt, Samara, Zaeed Massani and Kasumi Goto.

Shepard is also given a flat and, once the main mission is over, can organize a party. Squad mates can also be invited to the flat. They also propose you to participate in several activities around the Citadel.

The DLC also includes new enemies, three sets of armour, seven weapon modifiers and two weapons.

139807.description:
Walking through the Italian Dolomite mountains you can see special Flowers, Animals, Waterfalls, Canyons and Mountain Tops. The player who visits the most of these and builds their Rifugios (Italian for 'mountain cabin') in strategic spots, is most likely to win the game.

In Rifugio you place hexagonal tiles every turn with just a few simple rules (meadows next to forest, next to rocky areas, which in turn are the only areas allowed to have mountain tops. No rock next to meadows, and no mountain tops next to forest or meadows. A few special tiles have to match their sides exactly.

With your pawn (a backpacking tourist) you move around the placed tiles, visiting those that have special items printed on them (animals, flowers, waterfalls, etc.), and avoiding those with bears. By visiting special places, you collect a victory points card (usually 2 points) for that special place (for a bear however, you get -3 points). There are three items in each category, and collecting the full set earns you a bonus of 5 points.

Each turn you have two free actions available, to either move, or place a Rifugio (a mountian cabin). Each time an opponent visits a tile with your Rifugio, you get a card with 2 victory points, but they to rest (which is getting a card with an extra action they can use at any time convenient).

Game ends when all tiles have been placed, and whoever gathered the most points in collecting those cards wins.
139807.name: Rifugio
boardgameexpansion: Rifugio Uitbreiding 5-6 personen
Rifugio: Helicopter
Rifugio: Rivers & Rafts

139808.name: Armie Apokalipsy
139808.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Świat się kończy. To już ostatnie tchnienie. Nawet do szarych ludzi dociera przerażająca świadomość nieuchronnej apokalipsy. Nikt z postronnych nie zdaje sobie jednak sprawy z prawdziwej stawki, o jaką toczy się wojna. Pod ciężkim od ołowianych chmur niebem, na dachach wieżowców, pośród zatłoczonych ulic, w podziemnych kompleksach anielskie Zastępy przelewają krew, by wypełnić powierzone im przez Patronów zadanie – pokonanie Wroga i jego przerażających hufców. Bitwa już się rozpoczęła. Jej wynik przesądzi o wszystkim. Przebudzone w ludzkich ciałach anioły są jednak wystawione na liczne pokusy, które niesie ze sobą współczesny świat. Mimo, że płonie w nich światło Najwyższego, nie są pozbawione słabości zwykłego człowieka. Emocje i namiętności nieuchronnie prowadzą do grzechu,a grzech to pierwszy krok na drodze do upadku…

Armie Apokalipsy to gra fabularna dla pełnoletnich graczy. Jej akcja rozgrywa się w świecie bliźniaczo podobnym do naszego, w którym anioły zostały zesłane z niebios, by stanąć naprzeciw sił Wroga w ostatecznej bitwie. Gracze wcielają się w role skrzydlatych wojowników o nadludzkiej mocy, którzy dzielą czas między epickie starcia z piekielnymi hordami, politykę i intrygi w anielskiej społeczności, a korzystanie z uroków nowej, cielesnej egzystencji.

Uwaga: Gra przeznaczona dla osób pełnoletnich!

and translation:

The world is ending. This is the last breath. Even common people see the frightening and impending apocalypse. None - however - realize true stakes if war. Under heavy clouds, on the roofs of skyscrapers, amidst the crowded streets, in the underground complexes angelic Orders shed blood to fulill entrusted to them by the Patrons tasks - to defeat Enemy and its terrifying armies. The battle has already begun. It's outcome will determine everything. Awakened in human bodies Angels, however, are exposed to many temptations which brings the modern world. Although their bear the Lifght of The One, they are not devoid of weaknesses of ordinary people. Emotions and passions inevitably lead to sin, and sin is the first step on the road to fall... 

Armie Apokalipsy (Armies of the Apocalypse) is a role-playing game for adult players. The action takes place in a world similar to our own, in which the angels were sent down from heaven to stand against forces of the Enemy in the final battle. Players take the role of winged warriors of superhuman power, who divide their time between the epic battle hordes of hell, politics and intrigue in angelic communities and using the charms of a new bodily existence. 

Note: The game is intended for adults only!

139809.description:
Expands Rifugio to be playable with 5 or 6 players.

Also adds Secret Tunnels, which allow instant travel over larger distances.
139809.name: Rifugio Uitbreiding 5-6 personen
boardgameexpansion: Rifugio

139810.name: CineManiac: Horror Edition
139810.description:
A card/party game for 2-5+ people, played while watching any horror movie.

Players use Plot cards that coincide with actions on the screen to earn points, and Curse cards to force their opponents to reenact scenes or otherwise interact with the movie.

139812.name: Tower of the Ironwood Watch
139812.description:
publisher blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5–9.
On the edge of Varisia's Mierani Forest stand the ruins of an ancient guardtower that once served as the native elves' first line of defense against the threat of invasion from the bordering Thassilonian realm of Envy. Just as the elves fled Golarion to avoid the destruction of Earthfall, so too did they leave behind the Tower of the Ironwood Watch, which the Pathfinder Society now hopes to explore—a task that could prove more dangerous than anyone anticipates.

139813.name: The Veteran's Vault
139813.description:
publisher blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–5.
While many Pathfinders meet unfortunate fates in their ongoing explorations of the dangerous world of Golarion, some retire with decades' worth of treasure in their coffers, and their lives still intact. When one such Pathfinder approaches the Grand Lodge with the hidden location of her treasure vault, it falls upon a new generation of Pathfinders to retrieve from within a valuable keepsake. That they can keep anything other than the ex-Pathfinder's locket makes the assignment all the sweeter.

139814.name: The Night March of Kalkamedes
139814.description:
publishr blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5.
A veteran Pathfinder exploring the Fenwall Mountains of Varisia has begun sleepwalking, traveling through the dead of night in the same direction each time. The following mornings, however, he awakens injured and lost in the wilderness, never reaching the mysterious destination that drew him from his bed in the night. Something is calling Kalkamedes, something powerful, but unless he can make it safely to the source of his somnambulism, that power will remain a mystery. It falls to a team of Pathfinders to escort the sleepwalker to his destination and uncover the true nature of the strange phenomenon overtaking Kalkamedes's dreams.

139815.name: Mother's Day
139815.description:
Act as a stay at home mom trying to clean the house. Each player moves through their own house (a play mat) trying to clean. The first player with a clean house wins. The trouble is that there is a child in each house controlled by the game. The child moves through the house playing with toys and making a mess.

A child with no toys will help clean up but it is risky to try to keep they toys from the child because the mom only has two hands to work with. The child cannot go into mom's room or the garage so toys can be stored there but it takes time to move.

This game is part strategy and part luck.

139816.name: Beatmania
139816.description:
User Summary:

"Beatmania" specifically for the EU market, with a music selection pitched at EU clubbers, including 7 exclusive tracks from Moloko and more.

139817.name: Haunted Dungeon
139817.description:
Each player acts as a friend, relative, or associate of one of the greatest heroes in the land. The characters have all been kidnapped by the Jagjit, the Dark King of Aloion, and taken to a place known only as the Haunted Dungeon to be used as sacrifices. Jagjit hopes to bring about the return of Artamog the Butcher, an ancient dark god. Artamog the Butcher once ruled over all the world before Rachna, the Goddess of Creation, sealed Artamog and his children away from the world.
The characters must rescue themselves from the Haunted Dungeon. If the characters die while within the confines of the dungeon, Artamog will return to the world. If even one character escapes alive, the world will be safe, for now.
This is a tile based fantasy dungeon crawl. The goal is to fight through the rooms, collect items for defense, find and defeat the dungeon boss (a powerful enemy guarding the only exit), and escape.
As a twist, dead characters become ghosts and are still capable of influencing the game.

139818.name: Steam City Defense
139818.description:
Build defenses and collect parts so you can turn your city into a giant flying machine before a rampaging mechanical hoard destroys the land.

Roll dice each round to determine if you get defenses, flying machine components, or agents capable of sabotage. Work with or against neighboring cities. Each round the mechanical hoard will attack random parts of the city. The first city in the air wins.

139819.name: uDraw Studio: Instant Artist
139819.description:
Discover your inner artist with the uDraw Studio: Instant Artist, and express your creativity utilizing the ultimate, easy-to-use and easy-to-learn art creation experience available only on the uDraw GameTablet®. Join Remmy, the game's new 3D animated host, on an artistic journey through 15 all-new art lessons. Be inspired with a variety of paints, brushes and animated stamps as you create your next masterpiece. Enjoy fun activities such as coloring book, number painting, and dot drawing.

Comes bundled with the uDraw GameTablet® for Wii, X360, or PS3. Also available as stand alone for the Wii uDraw GameTablet.

Source: The Game Website.

139820.name: Steam City Warfare
boardgameexpansion: Steam City Warfare Expanded Fleet
139820.description:
Each player controls an air fleet and engage in a battle. Each side has a city, up to 2 airships, and up to 4 fighters. Once a player's city is destroyed, they are out of the game. At the end of each round, the wind pushes the fleet, complicating the strategy of troop deployment.
As fighters and airships are destroyed, new ones can be launched by sacrificing the ability to attack. Ships can crash into each other and mountains causing damage.

139821.name: Steam City Warfare Expanded Fleet
boardgameexpansion: Steam City Warfare
139821.description: This is an expansion for the game, Steam City Warfare. It adds mountain strongholds, drone missiles, and bombers to the game. Not intended as a stand alone expansion but can be played separately with a 1" sq type play mat (sold separately). Requires the rules from Steam City Warfare: Core Game and the Expanded Fleet rules.

139823.name: Sega Marine Fishing
139823.description:
User Summary:

"Sega Marine Fishing" converts the arcade experience for the home, building upon the platform of Sega Bass Fishing and adds a number of mechanics to encourage play including an aquarium mode.

139824.name: Monsteropoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
139824.description: A children's clone of Monopoly where the object is to be the player with the most Goosebumps (money) at the end of the game. The game ends when any player owes more Goosebumps than he or she can play. Small plastic faces with "hair" standing on end and mouth in a "scream" position are used to identify the owener of each property who also has a deed to the property.

139825.name: Internal Section
139825.description:
User Summary:

A rail shooter in the style of Tempest, "Internal Section" has the style & feel of Rez years before the Dreamcast game existed. This game could generate levels procedurally to any audio CD.

139826.name: Beatmania Best Hits
139826.description:
User Summary:

"Beatmania Best Hits" is a collection of 56 songs from previous Beatmania games, with various new modes & remixes of track info to increase difficulty for fans of the series.

Additionally, it worked as a Key Disk for the various add-on "Append" disks.

139827.name: Vampire Chronicle for Matching Service
139827.description:
User Summary:

Available only through the Japanese mail order service D-Direct, "Vampire Chronicle" collected various fan favourite Darkstalkers characters into an online-playable Dreamcast fighter.

139828.name: Football Bones
139828.description:
Using individually rated player cards and dice "Bones" players select from 10 run or 6 pass plays on offense, and 12 defenses to play a simple to learn, yet very detailed game of football. Football Bones builds off the original Statis Pro model by Jim Barnes and updates to a Base-10 system allowing for greater variability and realism in the results. Advanced statistics previously unavailable have allowed us to come up with the most accurate player cards and that translates to accurate play on the field!

Play by Play has been studied and every ball handler in the game now more accurately reflects on-field performance. 3 yards and a cloud of dust, yup we have that!

One of the beauties of the original Statis Pro system was and is the simplicity. Cover 2, Cover 3 it’s in there, Wildcat got it!, 6 Offensive lineman got it!, 3 Tight Ends got it! More plays and strategies, weather rules, a new model for quarterbacks and ball handlers. Solo, league, and replay tested…… All the fun and excitement of the original Statis Pro game is there and we’ve added so much more……

139829.name: Giant Killers
139829.description:
User Summary:

The only soccer management game for the Dreamcast, published only in the United Kingdom.

139830.name: Conflict PvP: Tactics and Teams Rulebook
139830.description:
publisher blurb

The Conflict PvP: Tactics and Teams rulebook adds advanced player vs. player mechanics to Pathfinder Roleplaying Game© and d20 fantasy games. Offering gamers a slew of dynamic new Match types, traps, boons, build kits, and over 30 pre-made combat optimized characters.

Whether you're looking to step up your combat, test your insane character build, or simply grind your table-mates into the dirt, Conflict PvP: Tactics and Teams has the tools you need to show your friends a bloody good time.

Like conventional Pathfinder or D20 campaigns, Conflict PvP uses a game master to run the matches smoothly, handle meta-gaming, hidden movement and ensure everyone is having a good time. Conflict PvP has dedicated chapters to the art of GMing, where any Gamemaster can find great nuggets on improving their craft. Moreover, the Conflict PvP: Tactics and Teams rulebook offers up many ways to sprinkle player vs. player competitions into existing campaigns. Several well-organized lists of plot hooks, magic items, artifacts, rule adjustments and dos and don’ts are added in, which means not only can GMs shake their campaigns up with PvP, but they also have another great resource for their traditional campaigns.

Conflict PvP is chock full of light-weight rules like the Battlepoint system, which allows players to measure their crazy character builds. Each match is assigned a maximum number of points. Participating characters' total values must be under the match maximum in order to be part of the match. This simple structure keeps combat fair and consistent.

By adding easy-to-use coordinates to official battlemaps, and providing double-sided passcards, the game designers of Conflict PvP have finally cracked the age-old problem of hidden movement in tabletop RPG games. This means opposing players will be unaware of each other’s movements when using stealth or magical effects like invisibility. In these cases, the players' miniatures are actually removed from the battlemap. Their characters' map’s coordinates are shared through a passcard until a revealing attack is made; making surprise sneak attacks truly a surprise.

included are
two full-color 24” by 36” Battlemaps

139831.name: Monopoly: La Rochelle
139831.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from La Rochelle, in France.

139832.name: Monopoly: Colmar
139832.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Colmar, in France.

139833.name: Monopoly: Aix-en-Provence
139833.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Aix-en-Provence, in France.

139834.name: Monopoly: Clermont Ferrand
139834.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Clermont Ferrand, in France.

139835.name: Monopoly: Mulhouse
139835.description:

139839.description:

Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Aveyron, a region in France.

139842.name: Quinto Império
139842.description:
Loosely translated from the publisher's site:
Game about the history of Portugal and the Portuguese identity.

More than a game, the Quinto Império (translated as Fifth Empire) is a journey through history and the identity of a people with timeless traditions.

Based on the 5th and 6th grade curriculum, the game is a extraordinary way of remembering the Portuguese origins.

Since the birth of the Kingdom of Portugal the kings always sought to expand the national territory.

Now, it's up to the player of playing a Portuguese historic character, and recreate the great voyages and adventures of Prince Henrique the Navigator, Vasco da Gama, Afonso de Alburquerque or other fearless Portuguese sailor.

Discover and (re)invent the Fifth Empire of Father António Vieira and Fernando Pessoa.

The destiny of the empire is in your hands.

Game play:
The purpose of the game is to get more points than the other player or get the starting objectives accomplished

Through the buying of national monuments with the trade goods acquired in trade posts or with the 14 resources, or the 9 Padrões (stone pillars with the Portuguese coat of arms used to mark the claim of land during the Portuguese age of discovery) that you can get by answering right to the questions.

139843.name: Monster Con
139843.description:
The setting is a horror convention. Your goal is to get close enough to nab the guest of honor—Desiré Delamorte, your dream girl—before the convention attendees discover that you're not just in costume. At game's end, one monster's going to get mobbed by con-goers. And one just might get away with the girl.
Each deck contains 56 cards--that's four monster suits and a couple of extra-special cards. Each suit includes the monster itself, ten convention attendee cards, one Desiré Delamort card, and one Flash Armstrong card (her sports star boyfriend).

The idea is to capture as many Desiré Delamort cards as possible, while avoiding attendees of your own suit. You especially want to avoid the Flash Armstrong card; he riles up any suspicious attendees.

Fortunately, each monster has a special ability: Dracula's mesmeric gaze, Mummy's whirlwind, Werewolf's shape change, and Frankenstein's Monster's sheer strength, for example.

Add suits for monsters from the other decks in the series (Return of Monster Con, Son of Monster Con, and Monster Con: Cthulhu Pack), and you can play with as many as sixteen players! Each game also contains a pair of non-suited cards—from "Sleeping in the Movie Room" to "Necronomicon"—to add their own twists to play.

The 4 decks include the original with Dracula, the Mummy, Frankie, and the Werewolf; the Return of Monster Con with the Amorphous Blob, Alien Changeling, Invisible Man, and Swampy; Son of Monster Con with the Bride of Frankenstein, Undertaker, Phantom of the Opera, and Ghost of Room 13, and; the Cthulhu Pack with the Cthulhu Cultist, Innsmuoth Cousin, Pickman's Apprentice, and Nyarlathotep.

With each deck, you can play with three or four people ages 13 and up. Playing time is about 30-45 minutes.

139844.name: Guilds of Florence
139844.description:
Guilds of Florence is a worker programming game where every player represents a clan of humble origin that is putting all their savings into improving the status of the clan. In order to do this, they will send their brightest sons as apprentices to some of the guilds of the city in seek of fame and fortune. To facilitate this, they will also marry some of their prettiest daughters to influential members of society in order to gain access to their exclusive guilds.

Game flow:
1. Coming of age: each clan adds a son ready to work and a daughter ready to marry to their resource pool.

2. Getting a job: each clan sends as many sons from the resource pool to find a job as apprentices as they want and can afford. To get a job as an apprentice, you must have influence in that guild, there must be an available apprentice slot (only one per guild every turn) and you must have enough money to pay the admission fee.

Other ways of getting influence in otherwise inaccessible guilds, is by marrying your daughters to one of the meeples already in that guild. By doing so you gain access to that guild as long as that daughter lives or if you have already sons working in that guild.
Some guilds can only be accessed by bribing the master a fixed amount of money.

3. Wedding day: each clan marries as many daughters from the resource pool as they want and can afford. To marry your daughters you need to pay the dowry to the lucky husband-to-be.
When choosing which husband in a guild you would like to marry, your clan needs to have someone (son or daughter) in a guild of the same class as the target one. For example, someone in a minor guild, can only marry someone in a minor guild, whereas someone in a major guild can marry anyone.

4. Pay day: in this phase salaries get paid, products get made and products get exchanged for money.

5. Time goes by: apprentices may become journeymen. Journeymen may become masters or keep improving their skills and maybe get a higher wage. Masters may improve their mastery and gain increased reputation and produce more products. Masters that reached the highest in their career, when time goes by, will sadly pass away. Same applies to their wives, who will also suffer the same fate.

6. Going to the market: each player buys as many products as they want and can afford. They can also exchange certain products for different products as a barter according to the market table. They CANNOT sell products for money; only masters can sell their own products for money.

7. Adjusting turn order: in turn order, and one at a time, players may exchange sets of products for licences (VP). Move the VP tracker for those players accordingly. Once all players have passed in sequence, the new starting player will be the one with the most VP at this point in time.

End of the game and scoring
The game ends when all players run out of meeples as they have all passed away.
The game also ends immediately if after one full turn, none of the guilds have any meeple on them but there are meeples in the clan or resource pools.
The winner is the player with most Victory Points.

139845.name: Monopoly: La France Agricole
139845.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from La France Agricole, a interest group (lobbying) for farmers in France.

139846.name: Monopoly: Morbihan
139846.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Morbihan, a region in France.

139847.name: Quest of the Mist Golem
139847.description:
From the first page:

Quest of the Mist Golem
Module QMG1 - Mist Hold
An adventure for characters level 5-7

139848.name: Monopoly: Isère
139848.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Isère , a region in France.

139849.description:
A new advanced scenario for Snowdonia based on the Bavarian Zugspitze railway built up the highest mountain in Germany (it is also one of only four rack railways still working in the country).

Designed as part of an ongoing Blog exercise, the scenario is being distributed - initially - in print & play form for playtesting & polishing (again part of the Blog).

The scenario further develops the importance of the Surveyor for work (building, excavating and track laying), uses a more benevolent version of Snow as weather and even has a Cable Car to get to the Zugspitze Summit.

PLEASE NOTE: This is now available in 'officially published' form but only in German as part of the Lookout Games Snowdonia: Erweiterung.
139849.name: Snowdonia: Bayerische Zugspitzbahn
boardgameexpansion: Snowdonia

139850.name: Zombicide Survivor: Adriana
boardgameexpansion: Zombicide
Zombicide Season 2: Prison Outbreak
139850.description:
Adriana had worked all her life just to get a chance. Blessed with potential but very little else, she worked days as a shop girl and nights rehearsing or performing with the chorus and dreaming of fame. Then, the zombies came out of nowhere on a busy Saturday and her dreams shattered in a few hours.

Adriana isn't alone, however. After a fierce zombicide in the mall with a team of survivors, Adriana decided to stop fighting just for herself and start fighting for the future. An enthusiastic volunteer, Adriana is now one of the fiercest zombie hunters in town. Her drive to save as many zombie survivors as possible and rebuild the city is a beautiful vision she shares with everyone.

Adriana is an optional promotional survivor available to those that raise an extra amount on their pledge for the Zombicide Season Two Kickstarter campaign. A zombie version (Zombivor) will also be included.

139851.name: Arrows of Indra
139851.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arrows of Indra is an RPG based on the original and most popular fantasy roleplaying rules; for old-school heroic fantasy adventure in a world that is exotic and at the same time highly recognizable, Inspired by the Epic Myths of India during the Age of Heroes.

Players take on the roles of brave Kshatriya warriors, disciplined yogis, temple priests, rogues or scouts, assassins of the dark goddess, magic-using Siddhis seeking the mysteries of the universe, playing humans civilized or barbaric, immortal Gandharvas or Yakshas, Vanara monkey-men or half-demonic Rakshasa; and adventure in Naga-filled jungles, fight Asura demons, visit the ruins of ancient Rakshasa empires, seek out the shining treasures of the truly massive Patala Underworld, fight duels for money or honor in the Kalari Arenas, or get caught up in the political and military intrigues of the human Bharata Kingdoms.

It’s the same heroic adventuring you know and love, but with a new and exciting environment. No anthropology, history, theology or linguistics degree required; everything you need to play heroic characters and adventure in the Bharata kingdoms is found right here in this book

139852.name: Soul's Reach
139852.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a tunnel collapses in the Dul'Urich Underkingdom, Prince Dwalin is sent to find a fabled pass in the north. Several days later his bloodguard returns beaten and malnourished claiming the prince and his band became dull of wit and disappeared sometime in the night. The news bodes heavily on the underking's heart and he entrusts his herald the task of finding his son.

Enter the characters. Herald Gal'kut hires you to find the prince. This is no easy task, as the prince's path lies over the Laridian Wastes - an area teeming with harpies and hell hounds. Even if you think you're ready to find them, think again. Someone powerful has found them first, and if he succeeds in his foul plans the world will never be the same again.

139853.name: A Bigger Problem
139853.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you and your friends agreed to help protect a merchant's wagon on its way to Shield Home in the Keranak Province, none of you expected what lies ahead! This is a rank 1-2 adventure for the BareBones Fantasy role-playing game. Although it is set in the Keranak Kingdoms, it could easily be placed anywhere in any setting. Written by Quinn Conklin, this is the first in a multi-part story arc which will be continued in [Children of the Giant's Fist].

139854.name: Children of the Giant's Fist
139854.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your mission complete, you await payment in the town of Shield Home and enjoy some well-deserved rest. But adventure waits for no man, and soon you and your companions find yourselves on a mission to save a child who has gone missing. The truth of his disappearance reveals a sinister plot that threatens all children of Shield Home. So much for an earned respite…

This is a rank 1-2 adventure for the BareBones Fantasy role-playing game. It is set in the Keranak Kingdoms, but could be placed anywhere in any setting. Written by Quinn Conklin, this is the second in a multi-part part story arc which is concluded in Striking through the Shield.

139855.name: Starships & Spacemen (2nd Edition)
139855.description:
From publisher blurb:

Boldly explore the galaxy in search of alien civilizations! You take the role of a Military Officer, Technical Officer, Science Officer, or Enlisted Man in the Galactic Confederation. Travel in a starship under your command, on missions of first contact, rescue, exploration, and more in a galaxy full of hostile aliens. Try to maintain the tenuous truce with the militaristic Zangid, and fight the Videni who may look like your Tauran allies, but do not adhere to a philosophy of peace and logic.

Design alien humanoids with either "original series" or "next generation" sensibilites, or blend the two approaches! There are 100 forehead shapes that may be randomly rolled when a new alien race is encountered.

This book contains:

Eight player races
Three main classes, with several subclasses
Rules for spaceships and exploration
many alien creatures
...and more!

139856.name: Monopoly: Puteaux
139856.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Puteaux, in France.

139857.name: Maelorum: Volume One
139857.description:
From the Introduction:

It is a time of forgetting. The world moves forward, and the old world fades away. It is true that once there were great powers and great people that moved the world, but those were very long ago, before my time, certainly before yours.

In the heart of western Maelorum lies the capital city known as Lordell. Old King Riordan Lordain tends to his ancient city, much like a steady farmer tends his fields year after year. The world moves ever forward, slow and steady like the seasons.

He does not see the frost forming early, nor do his knight commanders. The average person going about his day to day business in the city streets could never imagine what is about to happen. A war is coming, this much I can tell you.

The end of the wizards, a terrible, secret battle beneath the mountains, forgotten things are returning, old powers still great and terrible enough to shake the world one last time. Here is a story of things to come, a story of betrayal and revenge, and the rise or fall of a hero. It is not yet certain how this story will end, for this is your story, and it has already begun, even as you read these words...

139858.name: Brainwashed
139858.description: Searching for a way to transplant brains we found a new way to have fun. Dare someone to get Brainwashed. Place the Brainwash hat onto your head. Exchange Brain Hand pumps with your opponent, so you are holding the one attached to their hat and they are holding yours. On the count of three start squeezing the Brain Hand Pump using only one hand! Keep pumping the Brain until one of you is Brainwashed! When the brain in fully inflated, this will release the water held in the brain reservoir. The player with the fully inflated brain will be soaked with water. The winner is the first player to fully inflate their opponents brain so that they are Brainwashed!

139859.name: Rat Chase
139859.description: Let's chase a rat! The objective of the game is to be the first player to stop the rat running. The rat will run in random directions around the room for 20 seconds. Chase the rat around the room and hit the button on its back with your broom. The rat will respond with each correct hit by making a "yip yip" sound. Once you've successfully hit it 4 times, the rat will stop and make a crying sound. But if you don't, the rat will stop and laugh at you!

139860.name: Jumper!
139860.description:
Description from Matt Thorson, Developer:

"Not my first game, but my first worth mentioning. Made with Game Maker when I was sixteen, Jumper was a minimalization of the platformers I loved as a child down to their most basic concepts, making them simple enough for me to emulate. Help Ogmo escape the abandoned lab in this incredibly difficult platformer."

Source: The Developer Website.

139861.name: The Christmas Goose
139861.description:
Presumably, a simple roll and move game, given the times and the type of games that existed in the 1890's.

This 1890 game from McLoughlin Bros. is listed with a picture at Bored Games.

139862.description: Precision laser cut tray to hold population cubes in their correct location. This does not have a bottom or lid, just the "grid". 3mm thick clear acrylic.
139862.name: Eclipse: Population Cube Acrylic Tray

139864.name: Mechwarrior Personnel File - Liao
139864.description:
user summary

This actual "File" is designed as an in-game personnel file and contains several sheets like an After-action report, an insurance form and "first kill" applications as well as a letter by Maximilian Liao and an officer's commision. It also features a house Liao poster.

139865.name: Zombicide Box of Zombies Set #1: Walk of the Dead
boardgameexpansion: Zombicide
Zombicide Season 2: Prison Outbreak
Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue
139865.description:
This box includes 24 zombies and 12 additional "Walk of the Dead" spawn cards to add them into any Zombicide base game.

All zombie sculpts from this box are the same as the original Zombicide.

The Zombies breakdown
15 Walkers
6 Runners
3 Fatties

i.e. 3 of each Zombie sculpt from Season 1 other than the Abomination.

The Spawn cards consist of #43 to #54 - otherwise known as the "Romero" set - and contain only Walkers.

139866.description:
This box includes 24 berserker zombies and 6 additional spawn cards to include them into any Zombicide base game.

Sculpts of the zombies are from the Zombicde Season Two: Prison Outbreak, although three exclusive sculpts are included.

Zombie sculpt breakdown
15 Berserker Walkers (5 of a mix of 2 Box of Zombies only sculpts)
6 Berserker Runners
3 Berserker Fatties (2 of the Box of Zombies only sculpt)

Spawn cards (139-144) come with a higher density of Berserker zombies than Prison Outbreak's deck.
139866.name: Zombicide Box of Zombies Set #3: Angry Zombies
boardgameexpansion: Zombicide
Zombicide Season 2: Prison Outbreak

139867.description:
This box includes 24 classic zombies and 12 additional spawn cards to add them into any Zombicide base game.

Sculpts are the same as the ones found in Zombicide Season Two: Prison Outbreak, however this box set includes three exclusive sculpts.

Zombies break down as
15 Walkers (5 are a mix of 2 Box of Zombies only sculpts)
6 Runners
3 Fatties (2 are a Box of Zombies only sculpt)

Spawn Cards (121-132) break down as
6 are additional extra activation and sewer spawn cards, identical to Season 1 and Season 2 extra activation and sewer cards (2 extra activation for Walkers, 1 for Fatties, 1 for Runners, 2 sewer spawn cards).
6 are designed with a slightly different method. While keeping things relatively simple at Blue level, things get a little worse than usual from the Yellow to the Red level. Fatties and Runners come in greater numbers as well.
139867.name: Zombicide Box of Zombies Set #4: Walk of the Dead 2
boardgameexpansion: Zombicide
Zombicide Season 2: Prison Outbreak

139868.name: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow – Mirror of Fate
139868.description:
From the back of the case to the North American Nintendo 3DS edition

"Chained by fate. Cursed by blood. Revealed by destiny.

Join the famed Belmont clan as they seek Dracula's ultimate destruction.

Intense whip combat and platforming
Epic adventures with deep exploration of Dracula's castle"

139869.name: Public Domain Heroes and Villains #1
139869.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now true Fanboys and Girls you can own the Capes Cowls and Villains Foul versions of DM Studios Public Domain Supers series. In this first of 14 re-issues are featured the heroes and villains you have used for that other Supers RPG system. Now enjoy those same heroes and villians in the Capes Cowls and Villains Foul game system.

In this Dynamite Duos issue (with updated cover but same great art throughout) you will find stats for:

Black Fury and Kid Fury
Blackat and Black Kitten
Bullet Man and Girl
Black Cobra and Cobra Kid
Captain Battle and Souvenir

139870.name: Public Domain Heroes and Villains #2
139870.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now true Fanboys and Girls you can own the Capes Cowls and Villains Foul versions of DM Studios Public Domain Supers series. In this second of 14 re-issues are featured the heroes and villains you have used for that other Supers RPG system. Now enjoy those same heroes and villians in the Capes Cowls and Villains Foul game system.

In this Dynamite Duos issue (with updated cover but same great art throughout) you will find stats for:

The Black Terror and Tim Terror
Red Ann and Bo Briantus
Dr. Fission and Dr. Ghoul
Puzzler and Kroll Mull

139871.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In this issue...

Cover Girl Valerie James; Danger Woman!
We Review the Dysto Arms Plasma Pistol!
Fifi Reviews the Banshee Sky Cycle!

When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge!

139876.description:
Catan Shop Description
The official Settlers of Catan table is here! Built for the most avid players or for the families joined together on game night. Place the table top on (secured by flush magnets) when playing other games to use it as an all-around game table.

The Settlement Series offers gamers to use the original Settlers of Catan board game, 5-6 player extension, and Cities & Knights expansion pack.

This series of tables is built from Amish quality craftsmanship here in the USA.

Dimensions:
4" high (with legs folded)
31.5" high (with legs open)
50" across
139876.name: Table of Catan

139877.name: Extreme Edge Issue Eleven, Volume Three
139877.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In this issue...

We Review the Cheapass "Fashionpiece!
Sierra Reviews the Cosmetic Singularity Cantrip!
Sierra's Words of Warning!
Editorial: Gray Areas




When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge!

139878.name: Cimarron Strip
139878.description: The game is based on a TV show in the 1960's. Players are racing to claim territory in the strip of land between Kansas and the Indian Territory in the old west. There are 23 territories (areas) in the Cimarron Strip which are now open for claiming. Movement is by a spinner. Players start with a stand-up playing piece showing a cowboy and 7(?) claim tokens. The board consists of a map of the 23 areas, the starting area outside the Cimarron Strip, and paths connecting everything. Each area has one red space that the players must land on to claim the area. If 2 players land on the same spot there is a gunfight using a deck of "hit" or "miss" cards.

139879.name: Mass-Produced MAYHEM
139879.description:
From publisher blurb:

Robots for Everyone!

In the world of 2017, technology makes the world go around. Computers are ubiquitous, robots are becoming common place, and even biotechnology is in every home and school. The infrastructure that keeps mankind waking up in the morning, going to work, eating, sleeping, and living is composed of a thousand thousand technological processes, each of which is networked into all of the others to make life run smoothly.

From time to time, small glitches in this massive system pop up. These are annoyances in the day of the common person ,making them miss a meal, be late for work, or slows down the busy pace of their frenetic life. The system self-corrects, for the most part, and these glitches are either corrected, or adapted to. Life goes on.

In the rare circumstance that the system experiences a major malfunction, there is Hell to pay.

#5: Mass-Produced MAYHEM

The Gander Robotics Corporation has finally made humanoid robots available to the public! Their super-strong, super-durable robots are agile, smart, and all three models are super-useful! There are over six thousand of them out in the world right now, making life easier for thousands of people in every walk of life!

They probably should have given credit to the software engineer, though; because those super-strong, super-durable, super-agile robots are about to have their three laws turned upside-down, and there's going to be a super-mess of super-murder!

Can someone stand up to these mechanical serial killers? Someone had better... one of these robots can do the work of hundreds of people, and there are over six thousand of them out there, trying to duplicate (or exceed!) the most depraved acts of violence in history...

139880.name: Mankiller
139880.description:
From publisher blurb:


Her Name Is Lilly

The daughter of brilliant scientists working for the Parasol Corporation, Lilly is one of the world's foremost chemical engineers working in the field of fashion and beauty. In the world of Earth in 2016, her products are rapidly becoming ubiquitous, and there's no telling how far she will go.

Seriously, there's no telling, because in her free time she likes to blow stuff up to free female Incomplete Clones from slavery, and she has a secret lair where she's working on a plan to have the perfect child.

Those men that have been turning up dead and missing? Some of them failed to pass Lilly's inspection, and ended up dead. The missing ones? They're not so lucky.

Meet the enigmatic Lilly Celine and her cadre of hyper-dedicated powered armor troops, the Skinless Guard. Learn all about her plans, and see what can be done about them.

In the world of Hot Chicks, nothing is ever quite what it seems, but make no mistake; Lilly is a mankiller, and she's only just begun.

139881.name: Extreme Edge Volume One Collection
139881.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the First Time in One Collection

It's all twelve issues of the first volume of Extreme Edge! The January through December run of the fictional magazine for adventurers in the world of Hot Chicks, for the year 2015!

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In Each Issue:

A Cover Girl, a fully-realized NPC for use in your Hot Chicks games!
A brand new firearm, with statistics and a review!
A new piece of tech, magic item, or plot device!
Notes about the world of the Earth in 2015!
And an editorial by Kale Fleigh; Army Ranger, student of Dietrick Mars, chief editor of Extreme Edge, and adventurer!




Included in THIS COLLECTION ALONE... Desktop wallpapers for your computer featuring the female staff of Extreme Edge, each in several different resolutions to fit your monitor best! Including:

Fifi Fleigh-Blazes: Tech reviewer, IT manager and gadgeteer!
Ori Velasquez: Gun reviewer, survivalist, adventurer!
Sierra Devonshire: Fashion, Business, and Magic correspondent... mage extraordinaire!




When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge... the entire 2015 Collection!

139882.name: Extreme Edge Volume Two Collection
139882.description:
From publisher blurb:

All Twelve Issues In One Package!

It's all twelve issues of the second volume of Extreme Edge! The January through December run of the fictional magazine for adventurers in the world of Hot Chicks, for the year 2016!

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn't telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In Each Issue:

A Cover Girl, a fully-realized NPC for use in your Hot Chicks games!
A brand new firearm, with statistics and a review!
A new piece of tech, magic item, or plot device!
Notes about the world of the Earth in 2016!
And an editorial by Kale Fleigh; Army Ranger, student of Dietrick Mars, chief editor of Extreme Edge, and adventurer!




Included in THIS COLLECTION ALONE... Desktop wallpapers for your computer featuring the Page Five girls of the second volume, each in a number of different resolutions to suit YOUR desktop wallpaper needs!

When you live on the Extreme Edge, you're always a razor blade's width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge... the entire 2016 Collection!

139883.name: The Vitassi
139883.description:
From publisher blurb:


They Are The Vitassi

With over four hundred species of aliens poised over the Earth to despoil its every resource, someone has to be in charge of keeping them all in check. That job has been handed to the Vitassi - the most aloof and arrogant of all the alien races involved.

Green-skinned humanoids with tremendous physiology, the Vitassi were evolving before the Earth was even cooled from its fiery beginnings. They're advanced in almost every way, and the problem is, they know it.

Now, while their elders evaluate the Earth to determine whether it's more suited to joining Galactic society or being carved into chunks and handed out to all the other alien races, the children of the Vitassi have made their own discovery about our planet...

...it's a LOT of fun! The Vitassi children are among us, now, playing at being villains and/or heroes; anything, so long as the after party is epic!

Saving the planet just got more difficult.

Meet the Vitassi, learn about their advanced society, their biology, and the Artificial Intelligence that makes their enlightened civilization possible! Includes new Cyberware, new Martial Arts, new Equipment, and space ships!

139884.name: Mechan Resurrect
139884.description:
From publisher blurb:


You Can't Keep a Good Villain Down

He's back, and he's badder than ever. First introduced in Inner Darkness and spotlighted in Inner Darkness 2: The Depravity War and Villain-Net, the evil Artificial Intelligence known as M.E.C.H.A.N. now returns to Earth bigger and badder than ever.

He comes to bring pain and death, and to find the secret to saving the Universe.

Wait a second... who are we rooting for, again?

Mechan Resurrect includes new statistics for Mechan and his daughter Lillith, the Vampire Sex Robot!. Also included are stats on his newest minions and his latest workshop, the Pain Chamber.

See why Mechaphisto, the Demon Lord of Technology, has returned Mechan to Earth - and what the adventurers of Hot Chicks can do about it!

139885.name: Deathmask
139885.description:
From publisher blurb:


Deathmask; whisper it when you say it...

Even among the elite of Villain-Net, he is only a rumor. If a villain has failed too badly, or succeeded too well, they may receive a visit from him. They may have created impenetrable defenses and surrounded themselves with loyal guards, but they will still receive a visit from him. He will visit them, and their career will be over, permanently.

Deathmask is the ultimate enforcer for Villain-Net. He will eliminate any villain that fails to comply with Villain-Net's agenda, and then he will ruthlessly seek out and eliminate any and all loose ends.
