Friends and family, collaborators and acquainances, until nothing of the villain's plans can remain.

Few have seen him and lived. He has more powers and abilities than anyone should be able to accumulate, access to whatever equipment he might need, and almost supernatural levels of skills. Is he a demon? Some kind of strange alien? Maybe a construct of the Hell Forges themselves, purpose-built to serve Villain-Net's needs for an enforcer?

What happens to those he abducts in the process of removing loose ends? It certainly can't be anything nice, for they are never seen again.

When the villains of Villain-Net say his name, they whisper it, because to say it any louder is to invite his presence, and no one wants that.

And now, he's in your Hot Chicks campaign.

139886.name: Omega Renegade
139886.description:
From publisher blurb:


Book Two of the Yojimbo Trilogy

Omega Thule, the world-wide villainous face of the Fourth Reich, is always looking to improve their game. Not satisfied with their Kette Truppen, otherwise known as the Chainsaw Ninjas of the SS, they have set aside a research facility in the United States to improve upon their fearsome shadow troopers.

When a young operative finds the Aryan ideal holding him back, he triggers a series of events that threaten not only the nearby city, but potentially, the whole world.

As if Chainsaw Ninjas weren't enough, someone had to go and throw demonic magic items and radioactive space aliens into the mix. Oh yes, an Omega Renegade is bad... but not nearly as bad as it's going to get!

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game, you will need the core rulebook in order to play. Herein, we update characters from The Chainsaw Ninjas of the SS!, and re-visit some equipment from the Nostrum Arms 2016 Arms and Armor Catalog, you may want to look at those books for reference. There will also be references to material from Librum Enchantus, Mechaphisto: The Demon Lord of Technology.

139887.name: Sexy Violence Incorporated
139887.description:
From publisher blurb:


When It's GOT to be Killed, Broken, or Both...

Some problems can't be solved by legal means. Sometimes things need to be broken, people need to be hurt, messages need to be sent. In the old days, before Villain-Net, you could just hire some people to "take care of it."

Now, things aren't so good. The Swedish Bikini Assassin Team is out of play, and the day of the "Million Dollar Hit" has come and gone. When you can find a dozen two-bit Super villains who will do the job for cheap (or for free!), who would pay that much?

There's a new alternative on the block. If you need some violence done, and you need it done right, there's only one call to make. You need Sexy Violence Incorporated!

See just how much damage three talented women can do when they set their minds to it; learn about their origins, their tremendous equipment, and the army of killer gynoids poised to back them up when things get rough! Meet their "boss," and find out why its a bad idea to chase him down and corner him. Most of all, find out what it will take to hire these lovely ladies to make life difficult for anyone... even the Player Characters!

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The RPG. You will need the core rulebook to play. It follows events in The Swedish Bikini Assassin Team, Strange Bedfellows (Hot Chicks), and Villain-Net; you may find those useful for reference.

139888.name: Corruption of Champions
139888.description:
User Summary

Corruption of Champions is an very adult themed text based fantasy adventure following the trials of your character, a hero or heroine, sent through a portal to another world where an unknown daemonic force is corrupting the land and turning the inhabitants in to sex crazed creatures.

The player is presented with many sexual encounters at every turn as well as possible romantic developments with various NPCs they may meet. The inhabitants range from fantasy creatures like gnolls, minotaurs, goblins and imps, to unusual animal people such as shark women, rodents, salamanders and more.

The players actions throughout will have impacts upon the development of the story and as they accumulate corruption and transformations it may become difficult to follow certain paths. Gender and species may be changed deamatically during the course of ones travels.

Combat can be via physical conflict, sexual taunting, magic or even strange abilities picked up. Defeated characters may be raped and possibly even become pregnant or get an opponent pregnant.

Updates have added new encounters and plotlines.

139889.name: Strange Bedfellows (Hot Chicks)
139889.description:
From publisher blurb:


Book One of the Yojimbo Trilogy

Times have been hard for the Swedish Bikini Assassin Team. No front man, no money, and the whole world coming after them for lethal payback. Just their luck they should happen to run to Bakersfield...

See what happens when the world's most dangerous swimsuit models hook up with the Lich Lord of Bakersfield. It's not a match made in Heaven, really, but lethal payback may just have to wait a little while.

Add a horrific tentacle monster to the mix, and almost anything can happen. Even assassins and undead Archmages may need a helping hand from Player Characters when things get this bad. Can you save Bakersfield before it falls... and leaves the world vulnerable to a toxic tentacle zombie apocalypse?

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game, you will need the core rulebook in order to play. Herein, we update characters from The Swedish Bikini Assassin Team and The Lich Lord of Bakersfield!, you may want to look at those books for reference. There will also be references to material from Librum Enchantus, Mechaphisto: The Demon Lord of Technology, and Villain-Net. While Strange Bedfellows is not an adult supplement, you may find a copy of our book of Dark Erotica, Inner Darkness, useful (it is not, however, necessary).

139890.name: The Last Vampire Hunt
139890.description:
From publisher blurb:


Something Has Arisen...

In The Last Ghost Hunt, a group of ghosts were encountered that were so evil, so malign, and so powerful that if they were to be released, they might change the balance of power in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind.

The ancient and powerful ghosts are posessed of tremendous psionic power and terrible purpose, but they're not the most careful beings, not by a long shot. When one of them has a chance to jump into what looks like a powerful body, it does so.

The horrific "vampiric" menace that is created is more than a simple blood-thirsty predator... it's a walking test-tube of extraterrestrial diseases, now equipped with world-bending psionic power.

Oh yes, it's time for a good-old-fashioned Vampire Hunt, but beware. It will probably be your last...

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The RPG. You will need the core rulebook to play. As it contains strong sexual material and very disturbing content, you may also need a copy of our dark erotica supplement, Inner Darkness.

139891.name: The League of Mediocre Villains
139891.description:
From publisher blurb:


Medicority, Assemble!

Not all villains are created equal. For every truly terrifying villain of world-shaking proportions, there are dozens of lesser villains who lack the ability to make themselves a threat to society. Individually, these villains may be so lame that no hero (or group of heroes) could take them seriously. When they combine their forces, though, there may be Hell to pay.

When seven of the world's most average and lackluster villains combine forces, they may actually become dangerous. It isn't so much that they have a great chance for success, but their failure is likely to be seven times more spectacular. Suddenly, adventurers had better sit up and take notice, because these villains can do more damage with their mistakes than any villain could accomplish with success!

And when you throw one or two villains in who are actually far more dangerous than they let on, it may unleash a new terror on the world that will threaten the very future and destiny of all mankind.

So, are you ready for a globe hopping adventure of surprisingly epic proportions, leading to an epic battle on an infernal space station? Ready or not, here comes the League of Mediocre Villains!

This is a supplement for HOT CHICKS: The RPG. You will need the core rulebook in order to play. The characters and adventure are based on information from our supplement Villain-Net, and will rely on that supplement for history and reference.

139892.name: The Mage Hunt
139892.description:
From publisher blurb:


One Wrong Word

Magic is primal, magic is powerful, magic is a matter of precision. With one wrong word, the intent of a spell can be changed, and its effect can be perverted by desire or even the balance of the Universe.

It took only one wrong word... one wrong letter in a translation of an ancient text... and a horror is unleashed upon the world. If only it were merely a freaky tentacle monster bent of the despoilment of all it touched, but it's worse. Much worse.

It's called Khadibariffi, and it is the punishment of the Universe on mages who reach too far. Of course, those who summoned it are the first victims, but now that it's here, it will not stop until it has punished all mages of their civilization, and the very civilization itself.

The Mage Hunt has begun.

Meet Khadibariffi, learn how he either consumes his victims, or puts them through the brutal and traumatic process of becoming his slaves. Learn of spells never before seen on Earth that exist to allow warfare against magic users, and see the dread Thralls of Khadibariffi that exist only to serve his dark will.

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The RPG. You will need the core rulebook to play. As it contains strong sexual material and very disturbing content, you may also need a copy of our dark erotica supplement, Inner Darkness.

There are also references to the cantrips found in Little Magics, you may find that book useful for reference as well.

139893.name: The Nightmare of Abul Khared
139893.description:
From publisher blurb:


Science Gone Bad

When the life of a talented scientist is destroyed in the Depravity War, he seeks to find those responsible and make him pay. What he finds, however, is a quick and dirty path to personal evolution, and the chance to become more than human.

Of course, the quick and dirty path is often the most dangerous; what he becomes in his twisted quest is a greater monster than any he had previously pursued. Now, he's a one-man Depravity War waiting to happen, equipped with technology millions of years beyond what the Earth is prepared to deal with.

Meet Abul Khared, follow his twisted journey, learn about his new technologies and the victims of his dread path to evolution. Includes new Super Powers!

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The RPG. You will need the core rulebook to play. As it contains strong sexual material and very disturbing content, you may also need a copy of our dark erotica supplement, Inner Darkness.

There are also references to the events of Inner Darkness 2: The Depravity War and information in The Depravity War Companion... you may find those useful for reference.

139894.description:
In Alchemist Academy you play a young and gifted student at Eggelstein Hall known better to the students as Alchemist Academy, a school for the magically gifted. Your grades have slipped. With only a few weeks to go you need to raise your grades and fast! There is only one solution..... if you can’t pass….CAST!

Game Play
Alchemist Academy is a fast, light-hearted card game for 2 to 6 players and is played in 30 to 60 minutes. Alchemist Academy is a hand management card game relying on 2 decks of cards, a Spell Deck and Shop Deck.

The game includes 23 different spells within the spell deck, which consists of 64 cards in total. Along with 6 different component cards which are required in different variations when casting a spell, this deck consists of 120 cards in total.

Each class (round) players attempts to cast spells on each other and themselves to increase their grade (score). Each of these spells require the correct components in order to cast it. These components are drawn from the Shop Deck.

Some spells are quick and easy to cast and only require 1 or 2 common components to be cast, however these only give the caster a small bonus. Other spells require rare or unique items to be cast and while this might take longer to obtain the right components, the resulting spell is far more powerful.

If the spell is successfully cast, there will be some sort of effect and the player who cast the spell gains points.
139894.name: Alchemist Academy

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
139897.description:
It is the eve of Carnivale on the magical Victorian isle of Ludobel, and you are all invited to the fantastical festivities!

In the card game Belle of the Ball, players take on the roles of party hosts, seeking the best mix of guests to make their gala the greatest by the end of the night. In order to ensure that they stay one step ahead of the other hosts, players will have to carefully watch the growing line of guests at the door, inviting those in that seem to share passions with partygoers already inside, all the while handing out their precious stash of Regrets to those who should seek refuge elsewhere. Of course, other hosts may find it advantageous to invite a rejected guest inside just to collect their accumulated Regrets for later use.

Hosts may also choose to ignore the competition for guests and instead try to earn the favor of the Belle of the Ball herself, whose charms can make or break any party.
139897.name: Belle of the Ball
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 61 - Age Before Beauty
Episode 76-- Spiel des Jahres chat and What we have been playing With guests Joel Eddy and Paul Owen
The Dice Section 18: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
The Dice Section 24: A La Kart with Daniel Solis
The Dice Section 6: Belle of the Ball
The One About Prezcon

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
139898.description:
It's a time of regrowth in the old urban center, and the hippest and best beer crafters have gathered both hops and hopes in building the best brewery in the city. It won't be an easy task, as players compete for precious resources such as malt, yeast, fruit and spices in the local markets, all while managing and optimizing their growing bottling empires.

In Brew Crafters, players assume management of a local craft brewery, working hard to manage resources, use their workers wisely, and develop their brewing line to create the best local brews. Brew Crafters honors the tradition of classic Eurogames such as Agricola and Puerto Rico, but at its heart beats a unique brewery processing system that must be constantly improved, monitored, and manned in order to keep the beloved beverages rolling off the line. Each brewery has access to a variety of equipment upgrades, local farms, markets, and a plethora of specialty workers, ensuring a high level of replayability and strategic avenues. In addition, each player is studiously working to be first to develop several rotating gold-label specialty recipes that will earn them extra points and prestige at the end of year three when the best local brewer will be honored.
139898.name: Brew Crafters
boardgameexpansion: Brew Crafters: Marketing Basics
boardgamepodcastepisode: #26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
Ep. 20 –  Medieval Academy & Abluxxen| Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 02: Board Games Are Bullies
Episode 1 - Our Introduction Into Gaming
Episode 1: Getting Started with Designing Tabletop Games
Episode 27 – Splotter Spellen Interview
Episode 58: TotalCon 2015 - Hops & Hopes
Episode 69 - Brew Crafters
Episode 8: Super Dungeon Explore: Forgotten King, Timecop, and Battleheart: Legacy
Podcast 27 – Brew Crafters and Dragon’s Demize 2.0!
Strange Assembly 170 - The Brew Crew
The Dice Section 20: Son of Catchup
The Good, The Board, and the Game That’s Better Than You Say It Is: Episode 29 Underrated Games
The One About Beer

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
139899.description:
VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game – or, more simply, VivaJava Dice – is the successor to the well-received 2012 release of VivaJava: The Coffee Game. As in its predecessor, players of VivaJava Dice take on the roles of employees at the VivaJava CoffeeCo., scouring the globe for the best beans to keep the company on top while keeping themselves one step ahead of the rest of the executives.

Also as in VivaJava, VivaJava Dice has players making the crucial decision between blending beans and research, but with a quick, new twist. Players must now use the dice in their pool to blend – using the beans to create a best-seller for quick points, then deciding whether to press their luck in subsequent rounds for bigger points but fewer dice as the blends degrade – or to research, which involves using their valuable beans to gain an ever-changing variety of dice-manipulating abilities, new ways to score, and paths that lead to aiding a competitor for a later payoff or hindering that competitor for immediate gratification. VivaJava Dice also offers a unique system of cooperative dice-rolling that can help you rise to the top, but at the price of someone else riding your coattails.

With an astounding mix of plug-and-play research abilities, subtle social play in semi-cooperative mode, and the chance to hog all the glory and blend the best for yourself, VivaJava Dice is all about choice, making each game fast and furiously different.
139899.name: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game
boardgameexpansion: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015
VivaJava: Al Gusto - Promotableau NR. 1
VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game - Game of the Year Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 020 – I, Geek Interviews T.C. Petty, III
Ep. 21 – Spiel des Jahres Trivia & Predictions | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 77 Origins preview, Buonocore drops by, and Xmen chat (spoilers)
Episode 8: Super Dungeon Explore: Forgotten King, Timecop, and Battleheart: Legacy
Low Player Count - Ep 20 - Our Top 5 Solo Games
The Dice Section 16: Viva Java: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game
The Long View: Dice Games
The One About Being Super
The One About Hobo Pain
The One About Prezcon
The One About Unpub 3

139900.name: Gears of War: Judgment
139900.description:
Before the rise of the Lambent, the sinking of Jacinto or the detonation of the Lightmass bomb, there was Emergence Day – when the Locust horde burst from the ground and set Sera on a path toward near annihilation. "Gears of War: Judgment” brings players back to the terrifying aftermath of E-Day, before the events of the “Gears” trilogy, for the most intense and challenging “Gears” game yet.

Source: The Publisher Website.

139901.name: Wireheads
139901.description:
"When two wireheads test their skills against eachother several factors decides the outcome; the ability to learn and adapt fast to changes, flexibility in strategy and tactics when necessary, master of both attack and defense, courage to try the unknown and wits to outsmart the other combatant."
- Enigma, also known as TripWire (Legendary Y-Gen wirehead)

Wireheads is a two-player deck building game set in a cyberspace environment. Players takes the role of a wirehead. Each character in the game has different strengths and abilities. Wireheads connect to the virtual world through an interface which may be upgraded or loaded with powerful software to be better prepared for the unknown. In the virtual world they fight for power and glory.

Choose a set of cards that fits your strategy. A typical round of Wireheads consists of a Draw phase followed by the action phase where players use enhancements, upload softwares and sabotage for the opponent in order to gain advantage. New cards are learned from the source and added to your deck. Cards on hand are both effect, software and power to learn new. All cards are freely played from hand without cost. However, stored software and hardware upgrades pay upkeep.

Strike at your opponents interface, exhaust their deck or archive, negate cards on hand. Everything is allowed in order to defeat your opponent.

Every game will differ from the other due to the fact that different cards are available and of those you choose only the cards that fit to the situation and strategy.

Strap up and connect, Wirehead.

"No strategy is good but the strategy to observe, adapt and act faster than your enemy."

The game components:
216 Cards (36 different cards with 6 cards each)
16 Power cards

139902.name: AHx-1
139902.description:
NO ONE HAS SEEN IT AND LIVED

You are given the mission of playing the most intense Military simulator action game featuring the fastest, most versatile attack Helicopter in the world - the AHx-1 Viper. Will you accept the challenge to fly the AHx-1 Viper? If you do - you will fly to different parts of the globe through enemy territory and if you're successful and lucky, maybe even complete the missions and return home safely.

Features:

· 45 different challenging missions utilizing the Viper's powerful battlefield simulation system.

· The world’s most versatile helicopter system, with an unmatched combination of agility and firepower

· Optimized for MMX chip with an all-new 3-D engine, for an enhanced realism - including actual aerial photos never before seen ...

· Developed by actual Israeli Helicopter fighter pilots for the most realistic mission simulation experience.

· Over 30 lifelike missions from Libya to Columbia, featuring present day military situations and military/political figures. Features Air-to-Air, Air-to-Ground, and Multi-Player network/modem combat.

Source: Archived Publisher Website.

139903.name: Space Shuttle Simulator
139903.description:
User Summary

This simulator allows you to fly a variety of Space Shuttle training scenarios and missions. Mission stages that may be simulated include launch, rendezvous, docking, reentry and landing. You can also modify or create missions using the enclosed Mission Editor.

139904.name: Space Shuttle Simulator & Apollo Simulator
139904.description:
You get both titles in one box. In Space Shuttle Simulator take command of the Space Shuttle as you blast off into space to perform various missions such as visiting the International Space Station. With Apollo Simulator revisit history as you are taken back to the very first moon landing!

Source: The Publisher Website.

139905.name: Air Attack Pack
139905.description:
User Summary

A compilation of five air combat games from NovaLogic.

139906.name: F-16 Multirole Fighter + MiG-29 Fulcrum
139906.description:
User Summary

A compilation of two NovaLogic combat flight simulations.

139907.name: Flight Mania
139907.description:
User Summary

A six CD-ROM collection of air combat games.

139908.name: Flight Squadron
139908.description:
User Summary

A compilation of five flight simulators.

videogame: Gunship 2000: Phillipine Islands & Antarctica Scenario Disk
139909.name: Gunship 2000 (CD compilation)
videogamecompilation: Gunship 2000: Phillipine Islands & Antarctica Scenario Disk
139909.description:
User Summary

A CD-ROM compilation of Gunship 2000 and the scenario expansion. The game was packaged in the same box as Gunship 2000 but had a sticker on the front stating "CD ROM Game!" and below that "Contains Original Gunship 2000 and Islands & Ice Scenario Disk."

139910.name: Jetfighter III Classic
139910.description:
User Summary

A compilation combining JetFighter III and the Enhanced Campaign CD with additional all-new content. The Classic edition adds a mission editor, 30 new missions and additional scenery.

139911.name: Jet Pack
139911.description:
User Summary

A compilation of three NovaLogic modern air combat flight sims.

videogame: Flight Simulator X Acceleration Expansion Pack
139912.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator X Gold Edition
videogamehonor: 2007 D.I.C.E. Simulation Game of the Year Winner
videogamecompilation: Flight Simulator X Acceleration Expansion Pack
139912.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Microsoft Flight Simulator X Deluxe Edition and the Acceleration Expansion Pack.

139913.name: Power Flight!
139913.description:
User Summary

A CD-ROM compilation of three combat flight simulators from MicroProse.

videogame: Tour of Duty: P-80 Shooting Star
139915.name: Secret Weapons of the Luftwaffe (CD compilation)
videogamecompilation: Tour of Duty: P-80 Shooting Star
139915.description:
User Summary

A CD-ROM compilation of Secret Weapons and the four Tour of Duty expansion disks.

139916.name: Sierra's Fliegende Asse
139916.description:
User Summary

A compilation of two flight simulations from Sierra.

139917.name: Super-VGA Harrier; MiG-29M Superfulcrum
139917.description:
User Summary

A compilation containing two combat flight sims from Domark/Simis.

139918.name: Ultimate Flight Series IV
139918.description:
User Summary

A four CD-ROM compilation containing three air combat flight simulators.

139919.name: U.S. Navy Fighters Gold
139919.description:
User Summary

A compilation of U.S. Navy Fighters and the Marine Fighters expansion.

139920.name: Sound Memory
139920.description:
A modern twist on the traditional game of Memory. THere are 24 tiles featuring 12 pairs. The pairs are represented by appropriate sounds on the electric gadget (who is called Marvin the Mouse).

The tiles are placed face down on the table and shuffled around. In a turn, a player presses the Green Arrow button on Marvin and a random sound will be heard. Now the player must look for the pair related to that sound. If successful, the player keeps the pair and presses the blue button on Marvin so that the same sound will not feature any more in the current game.

The 12 sounds are:
Cat, Thunderstorm, Road-Drill, Church Bell, Dog, Children, Wind, Birds singing, Rain, Car-Horn, Barrel Organ and Footsteps.

The winner is the player with the most tiles after all the tiles have been matched.

139921.name: Not Even Freedom is Free
139921.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this free Issue for Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul, the heroes face a group of revolutionaries intent on using the law to protect themselves. How can the heroes overcome them when they technically aren't doing anything illegal?

139922.name: The Other Side of the Mirror
139922.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Other Side of the Mirror is a short adventure for the Macabre Tales roleplaying game. Dark and sinister things await the protagonist, who has been hired to go to Rome, Italy in order to seek out truths hinted at in the dreaded Necronomicon. But the closer he gets to these truths, the stranger things get... until he finds himself in an incomprehensible situation that has to be experienced to be believed. Will he make it out with his life and sanity intact?

139923.name: Midnite Movie: The Gardener
139923.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a group of old college friends get together for a reunion at a sprawling mansion, they quickly find that they are not alone. Someone -- or something -- is watching them... waiting for the opportunity to pick them off one by one. Can they survive the night without losing their heads?

The Gardener is an adventure for the Slasher Flick RPG. It can be used with either the regular rulebook or the Director's Cut version of the rulebook.

139924.name: No-Frill Chills: Small Town Bloodshed
139924.description:
From publisher blurb:

No-Frill Chills is a line of Slasher Flick supplements that foregoes all the non-essentials in order to provide you with as much bang for your buck as possible. What you get is a bare-bones (but still very bloody) chunk of Slasher Flick gaming material that can be purchased for a dirt-cheap price.

This installment of No-Frill Chills is called "Small Town Bloodshed". It presents you and your group with an entire "Main Street USA" type of town, complete with details on more than two dozen locales, stats for numerous denizens, three fleshed out premises for flicks and loads of ideas for other flicks throughout the text.

139925.name: No-Frill Chills: S. S. Demeter
139925.description:
From publisher blurb:

No-Frill Chills is a line of Slasher Flick supplements that foregoes all the non-essentials in order to provide you with as much bang for your buck as possible. What you get is a bare-bones (but still very bloody) chunk of Slasher Flick gaming material that can be purchased for a dirt-cheap price.

In this mini-adventure, the hapless crew of a deep-space haulage vessel picks up a drifting pod. Little do they know that this will prove to be the worst decision they've ever made... and possibly their last decision as well.

139926.name: Victory System Core Rulebook
139926.description:
From publisher blurb:


Know Victory, Know Risk


No Risk, No Victory

What story do you want to tell? A thrilling tale of knights of old? A grim and gritty tale of street-level action and dirty dealing? A star-spanning space opera? Perhaps that no one has ever seen before, spun entirely out of the whole cloth of your imagination?

The tools for telling all of these stories as an interactive activity are here in this book.

The Victory System is a multi-genre Role Playing Game that gives you what you need to tell the stories that you want to tell. Set your game in the Fantasy Era, the Near-Modern Era, the Space Era, or a Custom Era enitrely of your own design.

Players can build Characters to suit the GMs campaign and their own concepts, from "talented amateurs" to skilled professionals. Included are fully-integrated rules for Martial Arts, Magic, Artificial Enhancements (Mechanica), Powers, and Psionics, as well as all the weapons, armor, and miscellaneous equipment that makes adventuring possible.

Victory is by no means assured, however. Danger lurks in every Era, and it's going to take a lot of Risk to see adventures through to the end. No Risk, No Victory.

139927.name: Thralls of Victory
139927.description:
From publisher blurb:


The Thralls are Coming...

Sometimes, a villain needs a little help. Whether it's with Magic, Martial Arts, Mechanica, Powers, or Psionics, they can now summon up that help with a little time and a little Risk. It doesn't matter whether they're zombies, robots, minions, demons, or creations of pure will and imagination; they're called Thralls, and they're coming to make life difficult for the heroes of every era!

Includes two new character packages (Thralls and Demons), new Magic Spells, Martial Arts Techniques, Mechanica Systems, Powers, and Psionic Disciplines for creating, summoning, and manipulating Thralls of all kinds!

Also included are thirty Thralls, including undead, minions, robots, demons, spirits, and the creations of will and imagination collectively known as Thralls themselves!

And who knows? Maybe Thralls aren't just for bad guys any more. Explore the economics of Thrall creation for fun and profit, try a little Necromancy or Diabolism on for size, and decide where you stand on the issue of free will.

Thralls can think and feel, but they're considered property at best. To most right-minded people, that's considered slavery; will you stand back and watch society run on the backs of enslaved intellects, or take a stand for the freedom of every sentience, no matter how inhuman?

Better make a decision soon... the Thralls are coming.

139928.name: The Castle Doctrine
139928.description:
"It's 1991, and things are bad. You're a guy with a wife, two kids, and a house. You're nearly broke, but you know that they'll be coming soon for what you've got left, hundreds of them.

You must spend what you have to secure what's yours. But every wall can be cut through, and every window can be broken, so you'll have to be smarter than that. With doors, wires, switches, and dogs---building something perplexing is easy.

Building something perplexing that still lets you get in and your family get out is much harder. After all, deadly traps aren't just deadly to intruders. Death through carelessness is quick and severe.

But who are these intruders, and where are they coming from? One night, after your grand security plans are choked back by your dwindling budget, you head out for a walk. As you pass other people's houses, you notice that many people aren't home, and some of them clearly don't suffer from dwindling budgets.

You climb the front steps of one house, knock softly, and find that the front door is unlocked. The gears in your mind start turning. No harm in having a quick look around. You open the door..."

Source: The Game Website.

139929.name: Penguin Land
139929.description: A fast paced game where you have to be really quick if you want to be the last penguin standing. In this fast paced game of penguin tug-o-war, each player spins his snowball as fast as possible until all of your opponent's penguins slide out of the tray.

139930.name: Flush!
139930.description:
A crisis has occurred in the most unlikely of places: the bathroom!! So gear up and get ready to capture the ugly creatures that have invaded the bathroom form underneath the toilet. Flush is a fast paced game where players race against the clock to get all their creatures into the toilet before it flushes and they get wet. Now you can play with the toilet water!

The first player starts the game by lifting the toilet lid, this will start the game and creatures will start popping out so you can capture them. Once the toilet starts to spin, scattering creatures everywhere, all players compete at the same time by attempting to capture the creatures of their headband color with the magnetic plunger--no hands allowed! Once you have shown your skill by capturing one of the creatures with the plunger attached to your headband you need to send the creature back into the toilet. Remove the creature from the plunger(now you can use your hands) and use the Flipper located on the game base that matches your headband color to flip the creature into the toilet. You need to work fast to get as many of your creatures into the toilet before the toilet flushes and sprays water into your face. Be brave and keep competing to capture the most creatures you can during the last 30 seconds of the game while the water is spraying. When the toilet stops spinning the game is over (approx. 3 minutes). This is the most fun you will ever have with a toilet. The player with the most of their colored creatures in the toilet will be the winner!

Contents:

Game base
Water basin insert
Smiling toilet timer
4 2-piece magnetic headband plungers
24 magnetic "little creatures"

139931.name: Free Your Glee
139931.description: Two teams take turns guessing the identity of the character on the WHO card by asking a yes/no question. Each team only gets five guesses per turn. If guessed, the team now tries to get the WHAT part of the card. Special mystery character cards are included to increase the difficulty. The first team to identify both WHO and WHAT get the character card, and if they get eight they win the game.

139932.name: On Wings miniatures game
139932.description:
This is a rule set of aerial combat set in WW2, Dynamic cartoon style aircraft capture the prominent features of the real planes. Though the aircraft are comic book drawn the maneuvers and abilities are based on reported aircraft performance both anecdotal and charted.

During a game players control from 2 to 12 aircraft by selecting an maneuver on their aircraft information cards, using a dry erase marker. the considerations in selecting a maneuver gaining advantage on the enemy position, and altitude, The maneuvers are then translated into the models movement on the table via a single maneuver template. various speeds of flight are handled in what maneuvers are available to a given aircraft. After moving, aircraft have opportunity to fire at valid targets. Fire combat uses a simple dice system and each craft has its own damage chart encompassing it's special strengths and weaknesses.

The game design features an uncluttered tabletop, squadron building, and aerial terrain and built in altitude rules. Basic and advanced rules allow you to choose what level of detail you prefer.
Scenarios including ground attack, bomber interception, meeting engagements and more. Each with their own criteria for victory: every thing from hit the target hard and get away, to total control of the skies, to protect your valuable bombers or airbase.

The rules are now available via War game vault, and include elevated paper counters to represent the aircraft models.

139933.name: The Forgotten Paths of Dailn
139933.description:
From the back cover: "The Forgotten Paths of Dailn is the first in a new series from The Dragon Tree Press that allows you, the reader, to control the destiny of the hero of the book.

But be warned... This series bears no resemblance to the less challenging "pick your own" books commonly available. The Forgotten Paths of Dailn is a game of wits between you and the author. A game he expects to win..."

139934.name: Gadget Guide: Utility
139934.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Utility

The ubiquitous "utility belt" can be the hero’s best friend, but a player's worst nightmare, when it comes to stocking all of those various pockets and pouches with just the right equipment for every occasion. This Gadget Guide looks at options for utility belts (and bags, bandoliers, and containers of all sorts) and the things you carry in them so your hero is never caught unprepared!

139935.name: Gadget Guide: Robots
139935.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Robots

As heroes, villains, and legions of minions, robots have been a staple of superheroes since the days of the first comic strips. Although they have become more sophisticated as real-world technology has moved ever closer to the mechanical marvels of comic books, robots remain common technology for both heroes and villains. This Gadget Guide looks at creating robots of all types in M&M game terms, and includes five sample robot archetypes!

139936.name: Dragon (Issue 421 - Mar 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Eye on the Realms: Abyssal Trade Goods
You Say Dragonborn, I Say Draconian
139936.description:
Table of contents

3 Pitch Perfect by Steve Winter
Another submissions window approaches! Warm up your pitching arms, you hopeful game writers.

4 Mephits by David Flor and Jared Espley
Mephits are at home in the Elemental Chaos, but they can be found as loyal servants all across the planes of existence.

10 Lords of Chaos: Cryonax by Michael E. Shea
Cryonax is an elemental being forged from the coldest formations of raw chaos and the demonic embrace of the Abyss.

17 Legendary Items of Krynn by Daniel Helmick
The Heroes of the Lance wielded many legendary weapons during their epic war against the Dragon Highlords.

22 You say Dragonborn, I say Draconian by Daniel Helmick
Have you ever wanted to play a bozak or kapak draconian? Now you can, with these dragonborn racial variants.

26 Alternative Multiclass Rules by Robert J. Schwalb and Matt Sernett
We offer a flexible, optional approach to character building that doesn’t require feat expenditures to access the powers and features from other classes.

31 Abyssal Trade Goods: Not a Bad Thing by Ed Greenwood
The phrase "straight from the Abyss" is used by traders all over the Realms to describe rare and exotic goods. A few, however, really do trade directly with the Abyss.

139937.name: Hive (PC/360)
139937.description:
Developer User Summary

Officially licensed version of the "Mensa Select" award-winning board game!

Hive is a board game with a difference. There is no board! The pieces are added to the playing area thus creating the board. As more and more pieces are added the game becomes a fight to see who can be the first to capture (surround) the opposing Queen Bee.

Features:

Play locally or online.
Includes "hot-seat"/"pass-n-play" mode for players with only one controller.
Full 3D with camera-control
Global high scores
The Hive board game is a winner of many awards including "Mensa Select", "Dr. Toy: Product of Excellence", "Spiele Hits", "International Gamers Awards", and "Juego del año".

139938.name: Net Gain: Corporate Espionage
139938.description:
Welcome to the year 2043. Information drives the new economy. Secrets can create and destroy empires. Corporate Brokers lead the shadow war, manipulating secrets to grow their own power while devastating their enemies… they’ll do whatever it takes to come out ahead.

In Net Gain, the player take on the role of a corporate broker, hired by a powerful conglomerate to sabotage their competitors by any means. You’re in charge of investigating targets, planning missions, assembling teams, and leading the operation to success. All in a world that’s rapidly changing every day…

Source: The Developer Website.

139939.name: Combat Operations
139939.description:
Back Cover

The FedCom Civil War: 89 Federated Suns regiments/RCT/Militia units; 75 Lyran Alliance regiments/RCT/Militia units; 41 mercenary regiments; 8 ComStar Divisions; 11 Draconis Combine regiments; 2 Capellan Confederation regiments.

All fought across a thousand lights on well over a hundred planetary systems for five long years. Now you can recreate it!

The Classic BattleTech Combat Operations rules expansion is the most comprehensive rules system for campaign play ever published for BattleTech.

Modern Warfare: Provides players with a primer on how war is waged by each major faction in the BattleTech universe.

BattleTech Operations Rules: Provides expanded rules for the creation, running and play of any type of military force.

AeroTech 2 Operations Rules: Expanded rules provide additional depth of play for any AeroTech 2 game, as well as integrated BattleTech and AeroTech 2 play.

Infantry Platoon Construction: Extensive rules for constructing almost any type of standard infantry platoon found in the BattleTech universe are provided.

Strategic Game: A rules framework that allows players to run grand-scale campaigns utilizing every aspect of warfare—combat, technology, subterfuge and assassination, politics and more—is provided.

Faction Force Tables: Comprehensive table of units available, by major era, to every major and minor faction in the BattleTech universe. Here's your chance to build that Star League division to take back Terra!

For use with Classic Battletech, Aerotech 2, Classic Battletech RPG

139940.name: Solaris VII: The Game World
139940.description:
Back Cover

"Let the Games begin!"

The bay door swings up and away, revealing your opponent across a labyrinth of obstacles rising from the arena floor.
Barely aware that the signal has been given, you are off and running, weapons blazing to cover your desperate sprint to safety.
Diving through a maelstrom of explosions, you round a corner and charge your foe, ignoring the insistent flashing of your warning lights.

Welcome to the Game World, where war is a busines and life is a gamble.

'Solaris VII is a supplemental for use with BattleTech and MechWarrior, providing everything needed for a MechWarrior to experience the life of a gladiator up close and personal. From the deadly 'Mech duels to the nightly intrigues at Thor's Shieldhall, Solaris VII challenges all the skills your characters possess.
Solaris VII includes a full-color map of Solaris City, a gazetteer of the Game World, a gamemaster's guide, and a full-color map for each of the 5 arenas run by the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere. Solaris VII also introduces the BattleMech Dueling System, a BattleTech expansion for running one-to-one tactical combat with more tactical options than ever before.

How good are you?

On Solaris, finding out will get you rich or get you killed.

For Battletech and Mechwarrior

139941.name: Don't Read the Comments
139941.description:
Taken from the Nørwegian Style blog:

Oh no… you went and did it again. You’re sitting there reading the comments. The news article itself was actually pretty interesting… so why the hell didn’t you just leave it? Why did you enter this realm of trolling, strawmen, false dichotomies, badly concealed agendas, and ideological sewage?

It’s too late now. You feel yourself being drawn into it. Into the comment itself. That one, on the screen, there.

It’s not just somebody’s warped, malicious, imbecilic and ignorant idea anymore.

Now it’s reality. And you’re inside it.

Luckily, you brought your friends.

139942.name: Jahrmarkts-Spiel
139942.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (50)
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on a coloured (red/yellow) space follow instructions glued on lid inside. A '6' allows you another roll/move.

139943.description:
Set of 3 precision laser cut trays to hold population cubes in their correct location. This does not have a bottom or lid, just the "grid". 3mm thick clear acrylic.

admin comment
note added June 26, 2015
this product is no longer sold by the publisher
139943.name: Eclipse: Population Cube Acrylic Tray (set of 3)

139944.description:
Set of 6 precision laser cut trays to hold population cubes in their correct location. This does not have a bottom or lid, just the "grid". 3mm thick clear acrylic.

admin comment
note added June 26, 2015
this product is no longer sold by the publisher
139944.name: Eclipse: Population Cube Acrylic Tray (Set of 6)

139945.description:
Set of 9 precision laser cut trays to hold population cubes in their correct location. This does not have a bottom or lid, just the "grid". 3mm thick clear acrylic.

admin comment
note added June 26, 2015
this product is no longer sold by the publisher
139945.name: Eclipse: Population Cube Acrylic Tray (Set of 9)

139946.name: dibdib
139946.description:
Dibdib is a party game for 3-6 players. This game includes two cloth bags, round wooden discs and cardboard heart markers. Each player takes two heart markers. The wooden discs are put into one of the bags and the other bag is left empty.

The first player reaches into the bag with the discs and grabs any number of discs and places them into the second bag. The first player then offers both bags to one of the other players. The second player then has a choice. Either take both bags or take only the second bag. If the second player takes both bags, that player will repeat the steps that the first player took. If the second player takes only the second bag, then the contents of both bags are revealed. The first player counts the discs in the first bag and the second player counts the discs in the second bag. The person with the most discs wins. The loser flips one of his heart markers to the broken-hearted side.

This process is repeated until a player has turned both of his heart tokens to the broken-hearted side.

139947.name: Succubus: The Reborn
139947.description:
While at first glance nothing more than a deck of vampire-themed playing cards, Succubus: The Reborn is a new take on a classic game tool: cards. Each card bears a symbol – Rock, Paper, Scissors, Bomb – that makes the deck ideal for fans of Live Action Role Playing (as they often need some randomizing element during play).

What's more, each card contains one or more unique (and sometimes hidden) symbols, which allows the deck to be used for Succubus: The Reborn, the first title in the Party Poker RPG line of games which is playable by 8-90 players (with one deck needed for each ten players). One player serves as the Dealer, who oversees gameplay and leads others in what to do; everyone else is divided as evenly as possible into four teams, the teams being vampires who are members of four great Lineages represented by the four card suits:


Diamonds – The Marquisi (The Elite Ones) blend in among mortals that they might trade in money, power, and control, all while clinging to an old world sense of protocol and social decorum.



Hearts – The Copeadora (The Beautiful Ones) are universally insane, but also very beautiful – a benefit which they utilize in order to slake their unholy thirsts at the necks of beautiful socialites and wealthy benefactors.



Clubs – The Bas-Bazouk (The Outlaws) are the enforcers, criminals, anarchists, and street-toughs of the Vampire world, plying their wits and their supernatural strength to devastating effect in combat.



Spades – Unlike other Vampires, the Profugos (The Forlorn) do not possess a soul; they are therefore cursed with deep, soulless, black eyes, and are prone to acts of immorality and depravity.


Succubus: The Reborn is played over three acts, and in each act, players try to improve their hand of cards to create the best poker hand. In the first round players can trade however they wish amongst each other as long as each player always has five cards; if a player manages to trade away a joker, that player takes a card at random from the other person's hand instead of any card agreed upon. When the Dealer calls time, the player on each team with the highest card in that team's suit is the Captain, and all the Captains then compete in a single poker hand with the cards they hold, trying to win chips in the process.

From the second act on, players can trade cards with the Dealer for the cost of one chip, taking a random card from what remains in the deck. To trade cards in the second act, you trade in the same manner as the first act or you challenge another player, paying them a chip to do. In a challenge, each player chooses and reveals a card from his hand, with scissors beating bomb, which beats rock, and so on. The winner of the challenge decides whether or not to trade. For the third act, you can trade only with your teammates. After the second and third acts, each team Captain again competes in a poker hand, with the winner of the third such hand winning the entire game and bringing glory to his team.

Succubus: The Reborn includes a number of advanced rules that add quests, shadow symbols that allow for better trades with the dealer, character sheets that add special powers to the game, and more.

videogame: LEGO Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy
139948.name: LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga (DS)
videogamecompilation: LEGO Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy
139948.description:
Lego Star Wars: The Complete Saga is a video game based on the Star Wars-themed toy line by the Lego Group. It is a combination of the game Lego Star Wars: The Video Game and its sequel Lego Star Wars II: The Original Trilogy.

The DS version does not have any online play. Also, the DS version does not include any new characters or levels, and several levels have been deleted, in addition to free play on vehicle levels, however it does include a few new mini games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lego Star Wars: The Complete Saga", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

---

User Summary

The Nintendo DS version makes use of adapted levels from the original LEGO Star Wars game, but is not a compilation title including all the features from that game.

139949.name: Island of Ignorance
rpghonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
139949.description:
From the back of the book:

Island of Ignorance: The Third Cthulhu Companion

"We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far. The sciences, each straining in its own direction, have hitherto harmed us little; but some day the piecing together of dissociated knowledge will open up such terrifying vistas of reality, and of our frightful position therein, that we shall either go mad from the revelation or flee from the deadly light into the peace and safety of a new dark age."
—H.P. Lovecraft, The Call of Cthulhu

Following in the footsteps of the Chaosium classics, The Cthulhu Companion—Ghastly Adventures and Eldritch Lore and Fragments of Fear—The Second Cthulhu Companion, Golden Goblin Press is proud to present Island of Ignorance—The Third Cthulhu Companion, a collection of articles and scenarios for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game.

Contained within these covers are:

Eight articles detailing dangerous artifacts, mythos tomes, and heroic investigators:


The Golden Goblin by Geoff Gillan—A mysterious statue with a dark side.
The Walshes: A Cthulhu Cult by Daniel Harms—The most dangerous rumrunners your investigators will ever meet.
Massa Di Requiem Per Shuggay: A History of the Devil's Opera by Scott David Aniolowski—Learn the secret history of this infamous alien opera.
Johnny Came Marching Home: Mechanics for Playing a Military Veteran by Oscar Rios—Flesh out your Great War veteran's back story like never before.
Dweller in Darkness by Tyler Hudak—A look into the tomes, minions and worshippers of a sinister Great Old One
The Knjiga Mrtva (or Book of the Dead) by Eckhard Huelshoff—A new mythos tome, the journal of a Serbian vampire hunter.
The Silks of Irem by Tom Lynch—A dangerous artifact taken from the corpse of the mad Arab Abdul Alhazred.
Raggedy Clothes and Worn Out Shoes: A Look at The American Hobo by Oscar Rios—Learn why the iconic American figure just might be the ideal mythos investigator.


Five frightening scenarios:


Consumption by Brian M. Sammons—The investigators stumble upon a dying woman outside of Arkham, leading them into a conflict with a secretive fellowship possessing unholy appetites.
Let the Children Come to Me by Mark Shireman—Missing children and ancient legends lead investigators to horrific crimes and nightmarish monsters on the outskirts of Aylesbury (For mature audiences)
The Lonely Point Lighthouse by Oscar Rios—The investigators are hired to debunk claims that a lighthouse off the coast of New London, Connecticut is haunted, but soon learn there is much more going on at Lonely Point.
With Blue Uncertain Stumbling by Jeff Moeller—The investigators travels to Key West, Florida to look into a mysterious wedding reception photo showing what appears to be a ghost of a strange woman reflected in a mirror.
Darkness Illuminated by Jon Hook—Something odd is going on at St. Lucy's School for the Blind in Arkham, where a new doctor is performing experimental treatment, with promising results, but unexpected side effects.


Also:

18 pre-generated investigators and a quick equipment check list page, allowing Keepers and players to dive straight into the action.

139950.name: Ace Power Trumps
boardgameversion: Ace Power Trumps Colony Ten edition
Ace Power Trumps Elder Earth edition
Ace Power Trumps Robo Legion edition
139950.description:
Much the same as Top Trumps. However, the cards are much larger (8.8cm x 14.5cm) and each card has 3 categories and a further 3 sub-categories.

Elder Earth set:
Categories (Sub-categories) - Physical (Strength, Skill, Stamina), Material (Armour, Mobility, Weapons) & Magical (Power, Force, Fearfactor)
Robo Legion set:
Categories (Sub-categories) - Mechanics (Fire Power, Forceshields, Armour), Capability (Speed, Mobility, Range) & Intelligence (Controlability, Efficiency, Identification)
Colony Ten set:
Categories (Sub-categories) - Physical (Strength, Skill, Stamina), Material (Armour, Mobility, Weapons) & Magical (Power, Force, Fearfactor)

Object of the Game: The winner is the player with either the most sets of four or the complete pack.
How to play: First decide who will be the dealer, he or she then shuffles the pack and deals it equally between the players. Any spare cards should be placed in the pot. The dealer then picks a card and chooses either a category or sub-category and calls it, the winner is the player with the highest score. he or she then collects that hand and any card in the pot, should there be any. The winning player then continues to play. The play is then taken in turns between the players.
A variant may be played by the addition of two dice. A player calls a category as with the previous game, then rolls the dice. the dice score is added to the card score to give the players score. The opponent repeats the procedure. The winner is the player with the highest combined score.

139951.description: Fishin' Holes is a family-style tile and token game designed for people of all ages. Players take turns casting out to explore tiles, then reeling in by claiming tiles with their tokens. The game has elements of memorization, poker-like bluffing, and some risk taking. The goal is to capture the most fish while staying away from hazards like old tires, boots, or weeds. The game contains 60 pond tiles, wooden player tokens and bonus fish pieces, a score pad and instruction booklet. Rules are simple enough for children as young as age 8, but there is enough strategy to make this enjoyable for adults as well. The game works well for 2-5 players and takes about 30 minutes to play.
139951.name: Fishin' Holes

139952.description:
Check out our official Clockwork Wars website: http://clockworkwarsgame.com/index.html

Game description from the publisher:

Clockwork Wars is an epic board game of conquest, discovery, and espionage from Eagle-Gryphon Games. In Clockwork Wars, 2-4 players command a unique race of creatures in a tense war set in an alternate universe where magic and steam-era technology collide. Take control of the human "Purebreeds", or one of three hybrid races (Troglodytes, Rhinochs, and Mongrels). Your goal is to vanquish your foes and accumulate the most victory points through seven turns of play. You earn points by fighting for control of territories that contain valuable natural resources. To win these battles, you need manpower gained by seizing villages and developing them into cities. Invest in research and discover astonishing new technologies, like magical Golems, an Analytical Engine, and the wondrous Spire of the Gods. Position your troops, research powerful discoveries, employ espionage, and conquer your enemies to win the game!

Clockwork Wars features:


A modular map composed of hexagonal tiles and nine territory types (including manufactories, sorcerer's towers, and citadels) that allows for infinite replayability.
Four different races to choose from, each with its own unique units.
Hidden and simultaneous unit deployment that provides constant tension.
Short turns packed with tough decisions.
Simple, diceless combat resolution.
A card-based espionage system.
A unique "technology tree" that is different for every game. Research discoveries in one of three different disciplines: Sorcery, Science, and Religion.
Light civilization-building mechanisms, as players upgrade villages into cities and research discoveries through three successive, historical ages.
Rules for both "free-for-all" play, as well as an official 2 vs. 2 team variant
139952.name: Clockwork Wars
boardgameexpansion: Clockwork Wars: Academy & Volcano Bonus Tiles
Clockwork Wars: Gulag & Dynamo Bonus Tiles
Clockwork Wars: Sentience
boardgameaccessory: Clockwork Wars: Plastic Miniatures for Unique Units
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 10 - The 2015 Ding & Dent Awards Show
Episode 15 - Why We Game
Episode 7 - Ding & Dent's Holiday Gift Guide!
Episode 80-- Gen Con Previews of Greater Than Games and Stronghold Games
Episode 9 - Craig Cillessen & Clockwork Wars Review

139953.name: Autobahn
139953.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

139955.description:
Foil promo card for Locke & Key card game.

During the game you can choose to not participate in trying to solve a challenge. If you don't participate, you may draw a Key card instead. Key cards can be played later to alter the rules of a challenge to help you win it or cause other people to lose it.

The Harlequin Key Promo card is a Key that is added to the Key deck and can be played as described above.
139955.name: Locke & Key: Harlequin Key Foil Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Locke & Key: The Game

139956.name: The Merry Game of Bicycling
139956.description: Typical spin and move children's board game with wooden pieces (red, blue, yellow and green). Game goal is to travel with bicycle from and come back to home first of all. During the travel players should pass Dear Park, Boat House, Pleasant Park, Apple Lane, Hillside Farm etc.

139957.name: Real-Life: Der Neo-Anarchisten Reiseführer ins wahre Leben
139957.description:
user summary

This is the German translation of the The Neo-Anarchist's Guide to Real Life sourcebook for Shadowrun, 2nd Edition.
It misses two chapters of the original publication ("One-way Communication" and "Guarding the Till")

139958.name: Operation "Ka-Go": Battle for Mars
139958.description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese anime series Space Battleship Yamato 2199. The game covering space battles for Mars .

Players control star fleet of either the Earth(Terran) or Empire of Gamilas.
The main engine of the game is use chit-pull system. Each turn, players choose to use how many chit for that turn. Each player has four different activation chits(movement, fire, torpedo and repair), but many starships can activate only one to three times in a turn.

The game include five scenarios, two is based on animation story and three is fictional. Winner determined by scenario specific condition.

139959.name: Sim Dreams & Nightmares
139959.description:
From the publishers website:

Feel More. Do Less.

The Sixth World is full of seductions, and perhaps no siren song is sweeter than that of simsense. Feel the rush of new love without the work of having to date another person. Skydive from the upper reaches of the atmosphere without leaving your couch. Experience every emotion humans are capable of feeling, and do it with a greater intensity than most humans will ever feel. Just don’t spend too much time wondering what it’s doing to your brain.

Alleys and backrooms of every major sprawl in the world are littered with better-than-life junkies who can do nothing but think about their next fix. Reality is nothing more a pale shadow of the vitality and energy they experience with the right chips and downloads. Their need is deep—which, in the hallowed tradition of the Sixth World, means they are ripe for exploitation.

Sim Dreams and Nightmares contains information about the full range of simsense offerings, as well as new qualities and addiction rules to fully reflect the toll that simsense and better-than-life offerings can take on users. Runners can learn how to deal with the addicts out there—and explore how deep into the seamier side of the Sixth World they want to get.

Sim Dreams and Nightmares is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

139960.name: San Guo Sha: SP Characters 2011
boardgameexpansion: Legends of the Three Kingdoms
139960.description: This expansion is a collector's edition. It adds new character cards to the game. Some characters were already present in the base version of the game but have gotten new artwork and new abilities. These new character cards does not replace the old ones, since the abilities are different. The cards were released monthly in some issues of Zhuo You Zhi magazine as a free gift.

139961.name: The Silent Age
videogamehonor: 2013 Indie Prize Best in Show Winner
139961.description:
User Summary

This point-and-click adventure game centers around Joe, an ordinary janitor in a large organization whose life takes a strange turn when he encounters a dying man who claims to have been shot. The man tells Joe that in order to stop what's happened, he has to get a message to himself, and then hands him what he says is a time travel device. With that, the man dies, and Joe's adventure begins.

139962.name: Mage Wars: Official Spellbook Pack
139962.description:
Build more Mages with the Mage Wars® Official Spellbook Pack!

Includes two amazing spellbook designs, each with beautiful detailed artwork by Nick Deligaris!

Each spellbook contains 20 pages, with four sleeves per page. That’s room for 80 spells! Spellbook sleeves are extra wide so that they fit sleeved cards. Never leave your spells unprotected!

139963.name: FrogFlip
139963.description:
Hungry frogs are flippin' aross the swamp trying to gobble up the most bugs. But those buzzin' bugs just won't stay put! Using your flippin' skills, and a little luck, you'll need to snatch the next meal before another frog hops along and ruins lunch.

FrogFlip is a 12-card microgame in which players take turns flipping a Frog Disc towards one of four Lily Pad Cards that are spaced evenly across the playing area between two-players. The target Lily Pad Card is determined by the top card in a stack of score cards depicting 1 to 4 bugs. The number of bugs depicted on the top card of the stack represents which Lily Pad Card to aim for (counting that many cards from the active player's side of the table) and the number of points scored if the Frog Disc makes any contact with the target Lily Pad Card. Players keep taking turns flipping the Frog Disc until all of the Bug Score Cards are claimed or one player collects five Bug Score Cards.

Two sets of FrogFlip can be combined for a four-player game.

139964.name: The Great Fusion
139964.description:
Year 2022: society has truly changed during the last decade. The good old times have vanished. Put your anti-hero cape on and fight for what’s yours with Max’s help in this unusual and hilarious adventure.

This is the first science fiction adventure as real as life itself. An adventure that merges the best of classic graphic adventure games with the fun look and feel of current comics.

Source: The Developer Website.

139965.name: In the Prison of the Squid Sorcerer
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
139965.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mermaids from Yuggoth Attack!

Your players have ransacked dungeons and slain mighty beasts, rescued the helpless and thwarted the sinister plans of demons. But they have never seen anything like the strange items, blasphemous rituals, or horrors that await within these pages.

Lurking herein are twelve short encounters for the Dungeon Crawl Classics roleplaying game. Judges can use these scenarios as one-off’s or as jumping-off points to further wierd pulp adventures. Each encounter includes a unique monster, and the book is packed with treachery, novel twists, and horrible predicaments. Whether it’s the Squid Sorcerer, Umbo the ape witch, or Malagok the Creator Beast, these encounters recall a tradition pre-dating orcs and elves when the pulp fantasy realms were just weird.

139966.description:
Bazooka Joe and Sigrid were the two heroes in the original (now out of print) Dust Tactics Core Set. For a limited time, Dust-models.com offered a pre-painted pack of just these heroes in two different paint schemes.

If you already own the original (now out of print) Dust Tactics Core Set, these would be considered an "upgrade" or an "accessory" because they are simply pre-painted versions of what you have.

If you only own the Dust Tactics Revised Core Set, these would be considered an expansion because they add two new playable heroes to the game.
139966.name: Dust Tactics: Joe vs Sigrid
boardgameexpansion: Dust Tactics: Revised Core Set

139967.name: The First Doctor Sourcebook
rpgissuearticle: Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space RPG — The First Doctor Sourcebook
139967.description:
From publisher blurb:

Celebrating the 50th anniversary year of Doctor Who, this Sourcebook explores the First Doctor's adventures. With detailed information on all the allies, enemies, aliens and gadgets that he encounters, as well as examining each of his adventures, the book contains a wealth of material for the Doctor Who: Adventures in Time and Space RPG, and is also a fact-packed resource for fans of the show!

Return to where it all began, to a junkyard on Totter’s Lane. Visit Skaro for the first time. Wander the fourth dimension, travelling through all of space and time from the dawn of humanity to the far far future, with unexpected dangers and enemies along the way. Touch alien sands, and see strange birds wheel in a distant sky.

The adventure’s just beginning…

139968.name: Shadowrun (M&M3)
139968.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darnel grew up on the mean streets on the South Side of Megatropolis. His single mother works two jobs to keep food on the table for him and his little sister.

Darnel could’ve easily fallen in with the wrong crowd. But as luck would have it, he ended up in a small local gym known to train boxers. The owner and trainer Raul "Papa" Santiago, took an instant liking to the polite young man, and offered him a part time job cleaning the gym.

139969.name: Truth and Lies
139969.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Truth and Lies is the 4th book for the Wu Xing: The Ninja Crusade game line. In this game you take on the role of rival ninja who are forced to work together against the Izou Emperor's army that has been sent to crush you. This book will specifically focus on two of those clans, that are huge fan favorites, the Hidden Strands of Fate and the Will of Iron. These two clans are both metal-ascepted, but are polar opposites - the Strands are a clan composed of lies and manipulation, while the Will of Iron clan seeks out justice in a land full of so much unjust. The book will not only give new mechanical options (new powers, new clans, etc.), but will also build upon the setting information, providing more info on ninja territory, individual clan history and important NPCs usable in your games. Best part of all is that its told to the reader by the ninja themselves, the book being completely in 2nd person.

139970.name: Interludes: A Brief Expedition to Bluffside (C&C)
139970.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the first flakes of winter snow in the air, your party finally sees the end of their long journey in the hamlet of Kirkwood. Fornheim, the caravan master, has paid you well for keeping him and his profits safe for the last four months. Your escort is at an end. Bluffside, city of wonder and excitement, calls. Just a few loose ends and you can leave for your new lives of action and adventure.

An adventure for 4 player characters of 2nd level of play (can be adjusted accordingly).

Also includes the following:

New Creatures
New Spells
New Items
12+ new Places of Interest (POIs) in Kirkwood
30+ new NPCs




The original was an ENnie Nominee for Best Adventure!

139971.name: Tectonic
139971.description:
From publisher blurb:

TECTONIC!!

Considered one of the most destructive villains in modern history, Tectonic is a geothermic nightmare! Forced to wear a containment suit, this magma menace is ready to cause havoc in your campaign's city today!

139972.name: Antagonists
139972.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Magi of the Order of Hermes often come to the attention of other inhabitants of Mythic Europe. Some see them as a threat, others as a target, still others as an opportunity. Some even want to help the magi to better integrate themselves into society. These might be mundane humans, supernatural creatures, or other magi, but they all have one thing in common. They're nothing but trouble. This book presents ten developed antagonists for use in your saga. Each antagonist can support an entire saga arc, and the struggle with any of them could become the defining feature of your covenant's history. Whether you like politics, investigation, or straightforward battles, there's an antagonist for you within this book.

139973.name: Lariat
139973.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lariat is a prime example of a gimmick villain with specialized gear. His crimes will revolve around rodeo or cowboy antics, such as stealing from carnivals or horsenapping Roy Rogers’ trusty steed Trigger.

This release contains details a golden age villain PL 11.

This is the eleventh in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

139974.name: Jumping Jack & Jill
139974.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jumping Jack and Jill are street-level hero siblings who fight crime with jump boots, staves, and batons.

This release contains details two golden age heroes PL 8.

This is the tenth in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

139975.name: Twisted Farkel
139975.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Twisted Farkel is sure to excite all Farkel fans and draw even more newcomers to the game. In this exciting version the points one player rolls are not his/hers to keep. The Determinator Die passes the final score for a given turn to players on your left or right. Additionally, unlike regular Farkel, players go out of the game once they reach 10,000 points. The winner is the remaining player with less than 10,000 points. With TWISTED Farkel, passing HIGH scores to your neighbor is the object of the game. When a player FARKELS, (i.e. score no points) their fellow players benefit.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
139976.description:
Cthulhu Wars is a strategy boardgame in which the players take the part of alien races and gods taken from the Cthulhu mythos created by H. P. Lovecraft. The game is physically large, and includes sixty-four figurines of the cultists, monsters, aliens, and Great Old Ones that range in height from approximately 20 mm to nearly 180 mm.

The game takes place on a map of Earth. Each player takes the part of one of four factions included in the base game. At the start of a turn, players Gather Power, then, during a series of Action Rounds, they spend this Power to accomplish various tasks, such as recruiting Cultists, moving units, engaging in battle, summoning monsters, building Gates, casting spells, and Awakening their Great Old One. When all players run out of Power, the Action phase ends and the next turn begins. Victory is determined by accumulating points on the Doom Track. The first player to 30 is the lone victor *if* he has unlocked all six of spell books.

Driving the strategy are a player's wish to expand his power base, and his need to accomplish six tasks to acquire his faction's spell books. Each faction has a unique set of monsters, spell books, and special abilities, and has different requirements to acquire its spell books. All factions have multiple strategies open to them.

The base game supports 2-4 players (the map supports 5 players), but with new factions and maps released as expansions it can support up to 8 players.
